Reviews.Title: “I will definately come back”
Reviews.Author: N H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it was a perfect central location(!!) but as I expected: it costs silence and some sleep, but the hotel was clean& the staff was very friendly, so always again!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: PLWildash
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in New York on a relative budget and want to be near to pretty much all the action, this is the only choice really. It is a couple of blocks from Madison Square Garden, which has Penn Station underneath it so if you are travelling by Amtrak it is perfect or if you want to jump on the metro to the airport or anywhere else. You can easily walk to Times Square and even Central Park. The Hotel itself is clean and comfortable, the dorm beds appear to be pricey compared to elsewhere, but its New York and they are spacious and en suite. The patio area is also handy to meet other travelers. The only thing that could make it better value for money is if there was breakfast included. On my next visit to New York, i will be staying here again - if i can book far enough in advance anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: edeangelis
Reviews.Content: Great location just a block from Penn Station. Our room was clean and small. We elected to have a shared bathroom, which was fine. The staff was great - told us where to find food and fun things to do. I would come again!

Reviews.Title: “Best possible place for price in New York city”
Reviews.Author: Kieran1987
Reviews.Content: The hostel is located really close to midtown a stones throw from Madison square garden and times square. We arrived and were warmly welcomed by the man on check in. He offered us a free upgrade which was great. The room was nice and clean and looked out onto 8th avenue. Nice roof terrace and air con were a bonus, would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “run for your life”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: the dept of housing , not to mention a few other authorities, should come here to check things out. in seriious need of inspecition

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Karen L
Reviews.Content: I can't complain about this hostel at all! My sister & I shared a double room which was small but this is NY after all! And my sister (2nd time visitor to NY) said it was bigger than the 4 person dorm room she'd stayed at previously. The hostel is close to Penn Station & Times Square so navigating via subway or on feet is a breeze. Bearing that in mind, being close to the action does mean there are sirens and street sounds going (the city that never sleeps!) but we'd brought earplugs and eye masks anyway so problem solved. There's no kitchen or microwave but plenty of food options nearby to cater from budget to higher-end tastes. Reception was welcoming - always attentive and ready to offer local knowledge or assistance so thanks to Issa, John, Tyron and Waz. The rooms are a feature - whimsically painted homages to NYC - and we stayed in the Esther Williams room but can't wait to stay in the Orbit room for my next visit. There was an issue with plumbing but nothing in life is infallible! Once I'd notified reception, they got onto it straight away and I was able to shower 30 mins later. Water pressure could be stronger but people should really relax and not complain about every little thing - you're on holiday and some things are out of anyone's control so you just gotta go with the flow. Overall, the hostel was clean and if anything needed attention it was promptly dealt with so couldn't ask for more. I'd recommend the Chelsea for the price, location and a quirky hostel with character.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and average cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Johannes Y
Reviews.Content: I should have gotten an alias; now I feel obligated to be neutral if not generous. The hotel is close to Penn Station and Times Square, which is a big plus. The lack of an elevator, on the other hand, is a minus, especially if you've got a lot of luggages with you, but good thing the staffs are happy to help you with the luggages so it's not too much of a problem. Inside your room, you can have a calm and soft conversation with the people on the street without having to raise your voice; I'm not sure whether that's an advantage or a disadvantage, but since the car honks quite often join your conversations, I guess most people would choose the latter. I've also used the showers in the hallway and the one in a superior room; the water pressure was weak. The apartments aren't entirely clean; there's a layer of dust on the floor. Furthermore, the toilet is occasionally faulty. I did not experience any livingstocks, my companions in the other room however, did. The staff members are friendly, namely the boy from Haiti and Mr Clermont. I wish Tripadvisor would let me rate out of 10 instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: smattijs
Reviews.Content: We stayed with the three of us one night at the Chelsea Star hotel in a deluxe room with one king-size bed and one sofa-bed. We were a little early but they already let us put our stuff in the room, while the maid was still busy. The sofabed was broken that afternoon, but when we returned that evening they had fixed it. Everything was clean. The location is really good and so is the price, I would return again. Front desk is not very fast, but very much willing to help you have a good time in NYC. Tip: bring earplugs, cause NYC is one loud city!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: JBen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my second stay at the Chelsea Star. I'm very surprised at the negative reviews by fellow travellers. I find the staff and location exceptional. The rooms are a good size for a NYC hotel. And for a budget hotel it was clean and in good repair. Dollar for dollar I am very satisfied and would highly recommend it for budget travellers. I would far prefer to spend my dollars on all that NYC has to offer and save a few bucks staying at the Chelsea Star.

Reviews.Title: “planning to stay at Chelsea Star in the future too”
Reviews.Author: R N
Reviews.Content: Usually I don’t write reviews but this time I could not resist, i always stay at the Chelsea star when I am in NYC (least 6times last few years) and I have to strongly disagree with the reviews before. The manager and also the staff were always kind and helpful. Best location – hotel is located next to the Penn Station in the middle of Manhattan from where you can access subway and trains. Noise – NEW YORK is the city which never sleeps. You can’t expect the entire city to be quiet just for you. Of course you can still ask for a backyard facing room which is a little quieter. Rooms – hotel has a variety of rooms – from dorms, single room with a shared bathroom through superior, deluxe rooms and also apartments so everyone can find the one which fits him (I prefer superior room with private bath) Cleanliness – the rooms are generally clean with daily towel changing I am planning to stay at this hotel in the future and I would recommend this for a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Never again in my life!!”
Reviews.Author: michelle l
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience, first, there are rats!! The manager response to that was ''This is New York, there will be rats'' Toilet constantly gets blocked, their response was ''it's the forth floor it happens when it's so high up'' (Well i have stayed in hotels 10 floors and more high, never had that problem.) They overcharged my credit card three times the amount, luckily i checked before i left or i wouldn't have realize till much later, he said it was a system mistake. When refund did not show immediately, I questioned, manager's reply was ''we run a multi million dollar company here, we won't do anything about $90.00 refund, go to your bank and ask them'', talk about customer service!! Refund did show up 2 days after, but overall impression of hotel and staff was unreliable and unwelcoming, feels like a scam to stay there! After raging, they decided to give us 30% discount on room and compensation on the food eaten by the rats. Only positive place about this place? The location. If you want to live with rats, not having a working toilet to use, and possibly facing a very unfriendly manager, then stay here, but i advice you to constantly check your bank account to make sure they don't scam you. Otherwise, no matter how tight your budget is, please pick somewhere else. Never would i ever want to step into this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Hundborg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Chelsea Star for 5 nights in oct. 2010. The rooms are a bit dated. The bed was horrible since the matress was cover in plastic under the sheet (probably to avoid bedbugs), and the plastic was crankling at night. The rooms has thin walls. The location is wonderful with everything within walking distance. The staff were friendly and helpful. We wanted a place to stay at night and that we got. The price is great compared to other hotels in Manhattan. I'd recommend it to anyone just looking for a affordable place to stay at night while in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Really good, great for price.”
Reviews.Author: Schmaxx
Reviews.Content: Like others who have reviewed, I was skeptical of the cheapish price and exterior of the building. But boy was I wrong! My friend and I shared a Dorm room with 2 bunkbeds in May 2011. We got upgraded from a 4-person dorm to our own 2-person room as it was available and the staff thought it would be nicer. It was very Clean and with good A/C!! Great in the warm summer heat of NY. As a Dorm we shared a couple of bathrooms with the rest of the floor, but no real problems there. It was really cheap for NY, but friendly service all round from the staff. There is a nice little communal outdoor seating area with tables and chairs available and is relatively quiet. It's in a good location, not too far from the big Penn Station, and the rest of NY. We had stayed 2 nights and enjoyed them both, especially the A/C. Recommended highly for those on a budget visiting NY.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Tezza06
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chelsea Star for 6 nights in December and wanted to share my pro's and con's. The only thing I could fault the hotel on was that our room was facing 8th Avenue and was very noisy, especially Friday night and was constantly woken up by traffic. Also the shower on the 1st floor was cold and poor pressure so used the bathroom on the main floor which was lovely and hot!! Although the room was small (and got fuller and fuller with our shopping bags) it was big enough as all you do is sleep there. I took fleece pj's as I was expecting it to be cold but the hotel was lovely and warm and most nights only slept under the thin sheet. All the staff were really friendly and were able to offer recommendations and advice on where to go, what to do etc.....I couldn't fault any of them and appreciated all their help. The location was good as it was only a short walk from the subway, loads of shops, food and Times Square. All in all you get what you pay for at this budget hotel so don't be expecting the lap of luxury. It's clean enough, safe enough, good location, great staff and free wifi and coffee. There's no lift though so wouldn't stay here if you couldn't do quite a few stairs. I would definitely stay here again but would request a room at the rear of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Cheap Room under $100 bucks”
Reviews.Author: TravelSeguro
Reviews.Content: Stay in room # 302 with own bathroom, avoid the rooms facing the street, they aree too noisy! Overall, a clean place to get some rest, shower and get out to the city. Subways and Buses are 3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: HHDXB
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by a friend, and unfortunately something must have happened between her staying there and me staying there... The room was clean, although the linen was just provided (clean sheet - not sure if the blanket had been washed) bed was not actually made. My room had the bed built into the wall and an open plug source right near my face, so not sure about he alt and safety there. Ceiling had clearly been fixed and patched up (no fresh coat of paint or even an attempt to match up the paint in the room). Extremely noisy with people traipsing up and down the stairs constantly and doors slamming. Shared bathroom was always disgustingly dirty or occupied (don't actually know how people can make a place of cleanliness dirty, but they did) - and I didn't have a hot shower in all the time I was there, which (fortunately) was only 2 nights. Won't be staying here again - it was the only time that I felt unsafe in my entire 2 week NYC trip. I'd rather pay a bit more for a VAST improvement on what you get. On a positive note, the guy at the front desk was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A great way to see Manhattan on a budget”
Reviews.Author: PucciniFan2011
Reviews.Content: Chelsea Star Hotel is the best value for money in an expensive, world-class city like New York. I stayed in the 'dormitory' accommodation. At $ 60.00 per night, in a secure, clean facility - it was very good value. Comparable private accommodation in "chain hotels" seemed to start at $ 350.00 per night which is excessive. This was November 2011. The room and hotel premises are clean. Because the roomates in my room did things at different times than me, I only saw them for max 20 minutes each 24 hours, so it was like having a private room. It can be an issue if your roomates are anti-social or inconsiderate, but I was fortunate in that respect. I was respectful and my roomates from Switzerland, France and Brazil were respectful too. All in all a fantastic visit to New York - thanks Chelsea Star, especially John and Issa.

Reviews.Title: “What was that smell????”
Reviews.Author: swiss-sarah
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST hotel that we have ever stayed in, ever including a non-ventilated bunker in Verbier and a hut in Africa. DON'T GO HERE, it may pose a health risk!! The front staff are very helpful and charming, maybe this was to make up for the fact that the hotel rooms are seriously offensive. Our first stop after checking in was to buy some air-freshner for the room . big mistake buying the same one as I have at home because now every time the scent of 'white linen' hits my nose I am taken immediately back to the rancid stench of which we were trying to cover up! We stayed one night - granted most of this night was spend in the Irish bar across the road as we decided that the only way we could possibly sleep here was to get as drunk as possible. Even after checking out the next day, the smell followed us about - What was that smell anyway? Dead bodies, rotting flowers, the great unwashed - something lurking under the bed - we never checked that as we were too scared to put our heads near the floor to look under the bed. NEVER EVER stay in the place - it is a hole of stinking misery!

Reviews.Title: “Great when on budget”
Reviews.Author: Sander J
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, but that's normal in NYC. Location is great. Penn-station is walking distance, and around the corner are multiple 24/7 stores and a Subway-restaurant. There are also a lot of restaurants close to the hotel. WiFi is free, and worked great. The rooms and bathrooms are cleaned daily. Don't expect a luxury hotel. It is a great hotel to stay when on a budget. It's clean, and offers everything you need. When in NYC you are only in your room to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: diekudus
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel ( superior room) over the internet for my stay in New York during August 2011. After 23 hours of traveling i arrived at the hotel at 1 pm and was not allowed to see the room before 3pm as this was the rules and they were not prepared to make any exception. I requested to see the room as it looked nothing like i imagined or what was advertised. The furniture is old and tacky, only certain channels of the "flat screen" tv worked, the shower was broken, the bath plug was not working, the flushing mechanism of the toilet was broken, the safe was left of the dresser table (not even mounted). When i brought this to the attention of the front office manager i was offered another room for the next day. Honesly, if you want to waste your money on this dump with yello hand painted stars on the roof and walls, be my guest. I eventually checked out the next morning and checked in at the Gem Hotel 300 W22 for $40 a night cheaper, with room service, coffee, tea in the room, clean linen and most of all professional, friendly staff... A full package and far superior than this rat hole. Its nothing what they advertise it to be... Be warned!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Change of management? It's gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: Pinkybee
Reviews.Content: The new management are useless! BRING BACK JOHN! I've stayed here before and loved the first visit. Our 2nd visit in Dec 2010/Jan 2011 not so much. Our room had no heating during a blizzard and despite telling the staff earlier in the night they claimed that the heating was still being switched on, however at midnight and the radiators being stone cold they FINALLY moved us to another room and admitted the heating was broken. Stayed again in July 2011 and brought along friends who had come for our wedding. So disappointing as we had talked 3 into changing their booked accom to stay here so we could all be together. One of our friends turned up to be told his booked room wasn't available anymore but it turned out they had just screwed up their booking form. On our 2nd stay of the July trip our friend advised the staff we were checking in and that she gave permission for us to access her room as she had our bags. We turned up, checked in and were told we couldn't get our bags and that she needed to email them if she wanted us to go into her room. I understand that they were worried about security, however she had spoken to the same guy (the French guy) who said it was okay, we had shown our ID to him, he still said no. In the end she called him and went over it AGAIN and we were allowed in to get our bag. The internet still drops out on the first floor, I asked if they could reset the router as they had the 4 previous visits so that it would work but the same guy told me he would not as they never have internet problems. In 18 months and after 5 stays at this place I can assure you, the wifi drops out constantly on the first floor. He refused to press a button, just a mere button, it was too much to ask of him! We will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “well center”
Reviews.Author: monicdavid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a easy getting there from the train station (Penn), 5 min. walk; easy getting around to visit and easy getting around to find a place to eat. . We received a very good service and the staff was open to optimize our room for a good price. The room was large enough with a clean bathroom, AC and TV. We recommend it for the private room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Jemand0
Reviews.Content: The place consist of two parts: hotel and hostel. I stayed for 2 nights in hostel in 2-beded dorm. At first sight the hostel looked good. It had an attractive and nice decoration. The stuff is nice and helpful. The room was tiny and beside the bunk bed there was some kind of closet and a TV. The bathrooms were clean and generally ok, however there was only the one shower per storey - it was definitely not too much! If you expect any kitchen - forget it. There are no kitchen facilities except of a single microwave oven. And at the end, the worst thing - I saw several times the mices running in my room! IMO - The place is not worth staying there. It is expensive (I paid 60$/night) and doesn't offer anything more then overnight. If you would like to stay in Chelsea, better go to "Chelsea International Hostel", just few blocks away. You will get there better service and pay less.

Reviews.Title: “Cute wee place, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: Tango_Tango45
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at night and we were welcomed in and upgraded to a private room which was great! All the artistry was so fun and the place was great. It is right nearby to Penn St station so if you dont want/need to be near times square; its a great midtown location. The air con was a bit loud but it was a great place for what we needed it for

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, no kitchen!”
Reviews.Author: Bec17
Reviews.Content: Chelsea Star was a truly pleasant surprise. The staff are professional and friendly. The rooms are clean and secure- although my bed (top bunk) was a little wobbly. My room had air conditioning and a very clean bathroom. In fact, as far as hostels go, 'clean' would be the best word to describe it- a very important budget travel factor! Free wi-fi, nice deck area with power connections, umbrellas and deck chairs. Guest lounge is tiny- really just a room with a coffee machine, washer and dryer but what more do you need- there's enough to do in NYC without needing the hostel to entertain you! The only draw-back is that there's no kitchen, which makes eating a slightly more expensive venture, but if you don't want to go far, there's an incredible deli across the road. I read some really negative reviews about Chelsea before I arrived and I'll be honest- I'm yet to see any of the negatives I was expecting. I'd definitely stay here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in New York, affordable and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: EJUpHill
Reviews.Content: Chelsea Star in New York City was a great place for our family to stay during our trip to NYC! It was the most affordable place I found when looking for a hotel. I wanted something close to Penn station and Chelsea Star is a block away. The room was all we needed, it was the Deluxe room that had two full beds and a private bath. chelsea Star also has other affordable rooms for the single traveler in which you share a bath down the hall. It was not fancy but everything was just what we needed. Everything was clean, they had coffee and tea available and a great patio to enjoy. A washer and dryer were available if needed. The only negative was that they did not have an elevator so we had to lug the suitcases up two flights of stairs. I would stay here again if going back to NYC! .

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever attempt in booking this hotel!! For REAL!”
Reviews.Author: siusin021
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very dodgy. They have charged my credit card even before I arrived and for some reason, my credit card bounced back and the card could not be used anymore (before a vacation, seriously!). After exchanging money and carrying cash to my destination, I didn't know it was the hotel's problem until I arrived late at night and they told me and showed me some e-mails that I wasn't aware of. The emails was in some other person's name (not my travel agent's name) and some other receipt showed me that the transaction didn't go through. Anyways, they even told me that the hotel was full and that I would have to go two blocks down to another area if I wanted to stay with them (they don't have elevators, so you have to move your luggage up and down the stairs before you get to the lobby or main doors). Luckily a young girl sitting at the lobby with her luggage told me that happened to her too! So I went over there and told her we should really get the hell out and find another hotel together. In the wee hours of the morning and a busy week in NYC, we were lucky to find a decent and better looking hotel for a higher price. Thank gosh! Anyhow, I thought that was the end of the whole situation and the hotel wouldn't bug me anymore. After 2 weeks later, my travel agent told me that they tried to charge her credit card again!! I think besides writing on this site, is there something else we could do? But Im not sure they have good measures in place if someone sued them or something?? JUST BECAREFUL OF THIS CHEAP DODGY CRAPPY HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but remember that you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Bowtell
Reviews.Content: Right near the Penn station and the subway, it's a great base for moving around the city. The staff were wonderfully friendly and helpful. Cheap internet and free tea/coffee avaiIable. I booked a double room with shared bathroom for myself and a friend but we were upgraded to the private queen. The prices are very good for this sort of location but the hotel itself had several faults I'm not sure they can/will deal with as a budget hotel/hostel. 1) Stairs! Lots of stairs! The man behind reception was incredibly friendly and carried my case up the stairs for me as I was pregnant at the time but I still had to lug my tired butt up and down the stairs several times a day. 2) Noise. I know it's New York City but the windows were single glazed and there was lots of traffic noise. Luckily, my friend always packs earplugs! 3) Because it is also a hostel, you have lots of "bohemian" types that stay and there also appears to be some semi-permanent residents. There was a party in a room on our corridor and the staff went to stop it which led to a screaming fit at 3am about residental rights. 4) The shower was just a dribble in the private room. We didn't want to complain as it was a free upgrade, we just strolled down the hall to the shared showers or took a bath. 5) One day the maid just failed to show up to make the beds or refresh the towels. 6) Now this is the only reason I have rated the hotel as low as I have - the other elements I fully expect of a budget hotel.....on the last night a mouse ran from under the desk for a minute then ran back. All in all though, I can't complain for the price we paid for such a great location and friendly service. We felt safe and the rooms were well heated and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Budget, Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: XXKobieXX
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Sat Hotel has been extended, therefore one half was slightly newer. These are where the apartments are, I believe. We stayed in the 4th floor apartment. Literally the only pain was the fact that there was no elevator, so hauling of our big suitcases was involved. Not much of problem if you ask me. The room was clean and plain. But for what we paid and where we were located it was above and beyond. You don't spend all that much time in your room, so why does it need to be flashy? Staff were very friendly. Penn station and madison Sq garden are round the corner- 5 min walk. Time Square is also within walking distance - maybe 10 min from memory. My friends and I got back quite late some nights and we felt safe in this area, but of course we were still being wary. = Fantastic New York experience!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go again Great location and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Peevery
Reviews.Content: I had a private room with a private bathroom. It was clean, secure and I would stay here again. 10 minutes from classic tourist NY attractions, 3 books from major subway stations, great food around in south manhattan! John helped me when I got there android me everything I needed to know, supplied me with a map and some helpful tips and o was on my way! This is a great place for those travelling in a group, who aren't planning on spending a lot of time in their hotel room (not that it's a bad room), and who enjoying walking. Although this hotel is centrally located it is nice to be able to take the subway to the end of the line and walk the various villages to end up back at the Chelsea star. I was supposed to stay at another location and it was flooded so the booking agency I used moved me to this hotel/hostel. I booked my 3 day trip last minute so places were a little expensive. I am not sure about the price of the Chelsea star because i didn't have to pay any extra fees for having to be relocated.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Central Hotel in New York City.”
Reviews.Author: BCAmanda
Reviews.Content: It is always difficult to find a clean, affordable place to stay in Manhattan. Chelsea Star Hotel was a great place to stay. I stayed in a 4 bed dorm style with shared bath. The bathroom was clean and had shelves to put things on. The water pressure was good and we had hot water everyday. You could hear quite a bit of street noise at night, so bring ear plugs! The staff was friendly and very helpful. This location is awesome. I walked to Time Square and Penn Station, and I could even walk to the Flat Iron District! The metro is only a couple blocks away, so it was very easy to get around. The roommates I had were amazing, and we ended up hanging out quite a bit too. It was a really great experience to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, BRILLIANT location”
Reviews.Author: jk121255
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on Trip Advisor about the Chelsea Star, I was a bit worried about my stay. However, I would recommend it to travelers on a budget. Yes it doesn't have an elevator, and it's a "walk-past-and-you'll-miss-it" kind of place as it is literally a door in the side of the wall. The people at the front desk are really nice and helpful and will gladly lug your luggage up the stairs for you - I had an elephantine suitcase which the staff member cheerfully lumped upstairs for me. Make sure to get maps, brochures and coupons from the front desk :) It's a no frills kind of place. I stayed in a Superior room as I was pretty keen to have my own bathroom. The decor is pretty dated but the room was a decent size and was reasonably clean. The walls are kinda thin so you can hear if someone next door is watching TV or having a chat or walking down the hallway. But if you're in New York you're not going to spend that much time in your room anyway. The major draw card for the Chelsea Star Hotel is the location. It's right across the road from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station, and is a short walk to the Empire State Building, and the blue and red subway lines. You can even walk to Times Square and Fifth Avenue from there. As with the rest of New York there are heaps of eateries around the place, and if you're feeling lazy about breakfast options then the hotel is right above a Subway sandwich shop. The hotel itself is not fancy. The staff and the location is the main reason why I'd recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Musigal
Reviews.Content: I was scared after reading some of the reviews, but this was a fine hotel. There aren't any "frills" but it was very clean and the bathroom was new and had nice Mexican tile. Much much nicer than I expected. The bed was fairly comfortable. There was MUCH more space than I expected. Definitely great for the money. Would stay here again, but don't expect luxury. The desk staff were SO NICE, they even carried my overloaded suitcase down the stairs at the end of my stay because I was all dressed up for a singing gig. It's great for solo travelers! I felt safe walking there from Times Square at night. Definitely recommend. The best part was that it was also very warm on a cold winter's night. Some places skimp on the heat, but not this place. A+ Also, there was FREE internet wi-fi which my friends who paid double and stayed down the road at a lux hotel didn't even have-- they had to pay a lot of money for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: popkid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant location. Penn Station is practically opposite the hotel, which can get you anywhere....saying that, it's within walking distance to Madison Sq Garden, Empire State Building and Times Square. The staff here were excellent, couldn't fault them. My flight got delayed by a day and they found me a room for an extra night, and helped me keep checking my flights. I stayed in a dorm room and shared with 3 other people. We had 1 bathroom between the four of us which was fine. It was regularly cleaned and made some friends while I was there. Theres no food or alcohol allowed in rooms, which sucked a bit but can understand why, keeps everything tidy. It was freezing in NYC when I was there but our room was so so warm, it was lovely coming in from the cold. Heating was on full blast all day....it did get a bit too hot at night, and found it hard to sleep. The Wifi went down on the last 2 days and was 'waiting to be fixed' which was a bit of a pain, but as I said the staff helped me check flights etc.... when I needed to. Will be staying here again in December. Brilliant place if people are travelling alone or just wanting something cheap and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! love the location & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: vas_yieng
Reviews.Content: Room is clean & cozy, fun decoration! Just short walk from the Penn Station, safe & convenient. Will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Star Attraction”
Reviews.Author: mwrnz
Reviews.Content: First up, I can't believe the negative reviews posted about this hotel. You get what you pay for, and having just spent two weeks at Chelsea Star I can honestly say it offers value for money, it's clean, has friendly staff and is ideally located. Sure, there are no lifts, the AC units can be noisy and you can hear the NYC nightlife occasionally going feral. But, hey, it's well priced. Our room was well cleaned on arrival, and was cleaned every day. The staff helped us with our cases, and always had a smile. The basement washing machine and dryer worked well, and were much cheaper than the nearby laundries. So give it a go people, after all you're in the Big Apple - you should be about and about for at least 18 hours a day anyway!

Reviews.Title: “I was nervous after reading other reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: Pinksandles
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and accommodating. You can ask them anything. The recommendation for the Greek place across the street was great! We came by train and it was a two minute walk from Penn station to the hotel. The hotel is made up of two buildings. We were traveling with another family who ended up in the other building. To get from our room to theirs we had to go down 3 flights of stairs outside then up 4 flights of stairs. We were told of this when we booked. If you are traveling with others you may want to request to be in the same building. The stairs are also a pain if you have a lot of heavy luggage. We had a large room with a kingsize bed which was quite comfortable, including the sheets and pillows. Although we were on 8th Ave. the window air conditioning unit blocked out the sounds from the street. My 14 year old slept on the pull-out couch and there was a cot for my 11 year old. Plenty of towels and pillows for all of us. No problems with the wifi. All in all, we would definitely go back to the Chelsea Star. I may just make sure to make requests for rooms near our traveling companions when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book then complain!”
Reviews.Author: Budgetcouple
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for a place to sleep. We had a double room with shared bath. Yes its small but there is room for your luggage and a place to sleep. It is nothing special except the location . Staff are friendly. There is a outside terrace area with a few tables to sit and relax. When you are buzzed in you are greeted with about 15 steep stairs to the check in desk. Then depending on where your room is you may have another 15 steep stairs to go up. You get what you pay for and if you are in NY to see the sights and/or enjoy the nightlife you are in a fantastic location. Walking distance to almost everything. Empire State building, Time Square, Penn Station and the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location! Returning in Dec”
Reviews.Author: Pinkybee
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, it's just so convenient to Penn Station and accessible to everywhere-my husband and I love to walk everywhere so may not be as described as the same by others who don't walk much. There are 2 delis on the corners, the best cheesecake and amazing pizza within a 1 min walk-couldn't think of a better location anywhere. The staff made some fantastic recommendations of places to visit and to eat (Joshua Tree and Starlight Diner). Staff are friendly, and will only engage with you if you go out of your way to engage with them- which suits us fine as we're pretty private people when we travel and keep to ourselves generally. It's loud as mentioned, but you get that in NYC so nothing to complain about. Rooms are small and a shared bathroom but you get that with affordable hostels. We found the rooms and bathrooms to be very clean and tidy. The only downside was that the free wifi was pretty slow and dropped out constantly. It's a hostel, if you've travelled before you'll get what you've booked :) Have booked a stay in Dec/Jan so pretty happy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't try to save money on accommodation in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: From_SwedenStockholm
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect luxury, since it's one of the cheaper hotels in NYC/Manhattan, but we should have had a superior room and did exepect it to be at least cleaned before checking in. And even this hotel isn't really that cheap. First of all, they had overbooked the hotel, so we had to stay at another hotel the first night. We got compensated by getting a free upgrade to a appartment suite (with refridgerator and micro-wave) for the rest of our stay, which was good since they don't serve breakfast at the hotel. We had to check out from our first-night-hotel at 11 AM and we didn't get our room at Chelsea star until 2 PM and even then it wasn't properly cleaned. They had more or less just changed the bed linens and the towels. The floor was dusty, the kitchen sink was dirty with leftovers and the garbage can was full. I mean, they knew we were coming from the other hotel shortly after 11 AM and they could have started the cleaning round in our room, to get it done in time. During our stay I didn't see them clean any more either. Just fresh towels and they made the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: emmajohnson_hogg
Reviews.Content: Please take my advice and never book into this dump - advertised as hotel on internet nothing more than a grubby hostel above a subway shop in realtiy, from start to finish was absolutely terribel, themed room = Dirty prison cell with Palm tree on the wall, both my boyfriend at I wept at the state of the place but seen as though we had checked in in the middle of the night (after waiting 1 hour outside in NYC with all passports/credit cards and money) on our first trip to NYC we had to endure one night in this tip. Nearly spoilt our valentines get way, booked into Hotel New Yorker next morning as would rather have slept on a bench in Central Park (Probably safer and cleaner). New Yorker Best Hotel in Manhatten and for not much more money. PS the bullet hole in the sign outside should have given us some indication of the place. Save yourself the heartache.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat the location, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: j_girl9
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Star Hotel is on the corner of West 30th and 8th Avenue so obviously there is a bit of noise in the background, but nothing that would stop me from sleeping. The location is good for a budget NYC hostel, however you can definitely get a nicer place for the same place a bit further out on the train line (see HI New York up on Columbus). I'm in a 6 Bed dorm all girls, the bathroom is quite large, with a shower/tub ensemble, mirror's a bit high (but I'm just short)... however there is a full length mirror, which is always a bonus! Lots of powerpoints, free really good wifi, small terrace/courtyard... BUT the one thing that will stop me from ever staying here again... STAIRS. There is no lift in this building, and for a couple of 5ft girls, dragging 20kg suitcases up stairs is NOT FUN. Overall, still a nice place if you're looking for a hostel right in the middle of the city, reasonably priced for the location, and if you can handle lugging your suitcase up the stairs :) Oh and no lockers in the room, and no kitchen (that I could find)... the website kinda talked this place up more.. however staff are friendly enough. It is a hostel not a hotel. -Bunk beds are super creaky, impossible to get off the top bunk without squeaking -You can hear people walking and talking in the corridor, the floor above you, and out in the courtyard :( -There's no hooks in the bathroom! However, it's a good place to set up camp if all you're going to do is sleep there- but if in New York again I would try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're on your own and don't mind bunk-beds”
Reviews.Author: DocMoMan
Reviews.Content: Lets me start with the bottom line. Three nights in Manhattan, across the road from Penn Station, in May... all for under a $100, is always a steal. Add a rat-free habitat, free WiFi (which worked 50% of the time) and a complimentary postcard and you have yourselves Chelsea Star Hostel on 30th and 7th in mid-town Manhattan. Now here’s the downside: you never know what kind of roommates you’re going to get. My room had 6 bunk beds in it. The room was spacious, clean wood floor and connected to another room (a much bigger one with 8 beds) by a short aisle that housed 4 smallish bathrooms (each with a dwarf sink and a reasonably clean shower). They are all shared, first-come first-(clean)get basis. Since I got up at 4:30 every morning, I mostly enjoyed an uncontaminated bathroom with a dry floor. Windows faced 30th street with sound of trucks, screaming pedestrians and police sirens kept entertaining me for most of the night into the wee hours of the morning. Fortunately, I had earphones and earplugs, so wasn’t bothered much. There is no cooling system in the room, not even a fan. When it hit the high 70s one night, it got really hot and humid in the room. So bring a tiny fan (air conditioner if possible). I had the upper tier bed so my downstair neighbor’s movements in the bed were not a source of bother for me. Can’t say the same thing for him/her (never got to see them because I would be the last one to arrive after everyone had fallen asleep). The location is great, service is so so (they basically stay out of your business), hygiene is acceptable for a single person (not if you have kids) and the price unmatched. I will put forth a guarded recommendation – stay here only if you can’t find anyplace that’s less than $100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “What you pay is what you get”
Reviews.Author: sam20093
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in the Chelsea Star hotel, I was feeling somewhat apprehensive living in a 8 bunk bed room. Never have I stayed in a hostel before and twas an interesting experience, to say the least. The room size was decent, it was connected to the other bedroom which made me feel a little uncomfortable. It felt like a 16 person room. The bathroom was tiny. I couldn't wash my face without splashing water everywhere! They also didn't provide towels which was a huge turnoff. The bed was relatively comfortable despite the annoying noise it made. Needless to say, my expereince staying in the Chelsea Star was average. I paid $30/night so I guess what you pay is what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in chelsea star!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dermc26
Reviews.Content: This hostel is really expenseive for what its offering, and they falsely advertise. I booked a twin room with ensuite, which was meant to be 2 single beds, and turned out to be a very small double bed, to be fair, they were good about refunding the booking, but its a pretty crap place to stay having seen what is available!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice in a great location”
Reviews.Author: IndigoClover
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Japanese themed room (double room with shared bathroom). Hotel was clean and comfortable. The room was very small but that didn't worry us as we only used to to sleep in. The noise from 8th Avenue is loud (as others have mentioned), however, I'm not sure it would be much better elsewhere in midtown. I got earplugs and was fine. The shared bathroom was kept very clean. However, it was quiet busy in the morning around 8o'clockish and we had to wait a couple of times to get in (no wait in the evenings or early morning). The hotel is located close to Penn station, Madison Square Garden, the Empire State building and Macy's. It is also close to all the main subway lines (except the green one which you can just transfer to later down the line). Times Square was approx 15mins walk. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget wanting a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lucyingemann
Reviews.Content: Obviously being a budget hotel, it isn't fancy in the least, but it is safe, the staff are extremlely friendly, and the location is fabulous! We had a private room which was of a good size, and had a nice newly renovated bathroom. This hostel is within walking distance of everywhere, you can walk down into chelsea, and greenwich village and across the broadway or opposite direction up into the upper west side, and times square etc.. The only complaint i have is of the strong noice from 8th ave, as New Yorkers have serious beeping their horn problems and it is never quiet! Also there is a nightclub across the road so on a saturday night - dont expect to sleep! There are also mattress protecters on the bed's so that you are sure that you will not get eaten alive whilst you sleep by bed bugs! All in all pleasant experience as in NYC, u rarely spend time in your room, so this is the type of place where you can base yourself and go off and explore the amazing city without feeling guilty of expensive hotel costs. :)

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: lgetwan
Reviews.Content: Single rooms in the Chelsea Star hotel are quite small, but painted & equipped nicely and very clean. The noise from the 8th avenue is remarkable, but hey, it's the city that never sleeps! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Unless you like furry company and lots of noise, go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: emmka
Reviews.Content: The same night we checked in we saw a mouse run in our room. We found droppings from the mouse in our bathroom on numerous occasions. Our door was left wide open by housekeeping (which appeared to have done nothing all week except empty the trash). We stayed in a dorm room and had also reserved an apartment suite. Part of our party arrived two nights before the rest of the party. We asked to see the apartment and talked to them about it two times. However, the night before the rest of our party arrived we were told the apartment had been given away. The noise is horrible! There were people talking outside our windows all night long. Not a place for young children with the language we heard. Had to use ear plugs, but still heard plenty of noise. Hard mattresses and cheap bunk beds. Very disappointed and would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: ibboibbo
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome from the very friendly staff when we arrived at the hotel. We had quite a luggage which we had to carry all the way up to the second floor of the hotel. With that tedious job out of the way, we were happy to find that our double room was quite nice - small, but very nice with a view over 8th avenue. The room was clean, and the shared bathroom/shower was always spot clean and relatively unoccupied in spite of the hotel being fully booked when we were there. It would have been nice to get Internet access in the room, but there was a nice terrace next to the service desk where you could sit outside and connect to the Internet. In all, I must say that this is a good choice for the budget traveler. The room we stayed in was extremely tiny but we managed to stay there although we had four fully loaded suitcases by the end of our stay. Don't expect any luxuries there since this is in fact a budget hotel, but a very nice one at that - One I would definitely recommend to fellow budget travelers looking for a stay in NY at a good location, with friendly staff, for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor/location...poor service”
Reviews.Author: luci144
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in November whilst holidaying in NYC. At first we were excited to see the lovely decor of the hostel - clean bathrooms, brightly coloured walls, a lovely terrace with tables and chairs and a nice room. We had a double bunk bed and a TV, so it was very cosy. You do have to walk up a staircase when you enter...you can get one of the staff to bring your bags up if necessary. There's no lift. The wait for the shower was a bit ridiculous as there was only 1 per floor, so you'd set the alarm to get up nice and early but could be looking at a long wait. Nothing too dire though. There were 3 toilets per floor which was good. For the price we paid (this was the most expensive of 3 hostels we stayed at in America), our expectations weren't met. Our first hostel was half the price for pretty much the same duration stay and also included free breakfast and wonderful service. I was in the top bunk and only had a bottom sheet and very thin blanket. Our first night, we were both freezing and asked for extra blankets the following day - they never came. We asked two more times after this for extras and again, they made a note but they never arrived! Three times!? Our room was also quite noisy and it was sometimes difficult to sleep (not the hostel's fault however). Otherwise, the room was comfortable and the location was good. The worst thing was that this hostel insisted they had organised us a 4am airport shuttle for when we checked out. We confirmed this twice the day before and they were very casual and reassuring it would be there. At 4am that morning, the shuttle hadn't arrived. In 15 minutes, the guy on the counter rang dispatch and they hadn't received a booking. Surprise surprise. At this stage, we were panicked about getting to the airport while the hostel guy wanted all the details so he could file a report with management. He said a taxi would take 20 minutes to arrive so we were best to go out onto the road and hail one ourselves. We each had 2 suitcases and a handbag and no key to get back into the hostel, so I had to wait with all the bags, holding the door open in the hallway while my friend had to run out and flag one down. We felt this was appalling and unfair on 2 girls at 4am. Luckily we got one, but all this stress so early before our flight didn't seem necessary! We feel better service would have made all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Funky with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: cootmom
Reviews.Content: I liked my room w/private bath, very clean and bed very comfortable. The desk staff were the friendliest, offering me an umbrella and a lot of good advice. The location is perfect, right near Penn Station and convenient to every subway line. Only drawback was a very noisy street outside but what can you do? It's New York! They let me check in early and let me leave my luggage after I checked out. Perfect for budget travelers and the non-fussy about amenities. There is no elevator, although the staff helped me carry my bag up. Good exercise!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of big apple!”
Reviews.Author: salvitraveller
Reviews.Content: We think, to have found the best deal in New York City! Very good prices and perfect location opposite Madison Square Garden. Although booked the smallest room (shared bath), we got a free upgrade (bigger room with private bath!) because of non-availability of the small room! According to other comments, this seems to be a common behaviour... :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok rooms and value”
Reviews.Author: bel81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chelsea Star Hotel for 5 nights in Oct 09. All the reception staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful, even when I told them at 11pm at night that my TV remote control was not working. After a change of batteries did not work, they organised for house cleaning to leave me a new one the following day which was greatly appreciated. The room I stayed in was basic - bed, chair, small rack with 3 coat hangers, and a small TV. It took me a few days to realise the smell that hit me each time I opened the door was in fact the smell of the Subway downstairs.... it wasn't unpleasant, but not overly enjoyable either. The bed was comfortable. My only complaint would be the white blinds on the window behind the bed that do absolutely nothing to block out the light from the street. I ended up buying a sleeping mask. The noise level was what I'd expected for a hotel on the corner of 8th Ave. The location was terrific - I went to sporting events at Madison Square Garden on 2 of the 5 nights and it literally took me less than 5 minutes to walk back to the hotel. It is extremely close to the subway entrances to Penn Station.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected”
Reviews.Author: Ilan_M
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for three nights via the web, received the confirmation. When I went to the the hotel the front door was locked and a note said no vacancy. I rang the bell and when I walked upstairs, front desk staff told that all rooms are booked. Even though I had a confirmation, the front desk staff keep telling me to come back next day since no rooms available. Later I was able to find an other hotel near by. Still Chelsea star hotel charged my credit card, now I have to waste more time on getting a refund!!.. poorly managed hotel

Reviews.Title: “A great budget place in NYC”
Reviews.Author: claire1976_9
Reviews.Content: We were on a three week trip in the US and couldn't afford the expensive places in the city so we found this budget place. The reviews were good and the price was okay. We were pleasantly surprised. It's got a real hostel feel so pretty laid back. The staff were really friendly and went out of their way to help you. It was close to a subway stop which meant we could catch the subway from the airport to the hotel, and was easy access for all the main attractions. The traffic outside was quiet noisy but you would get that anywhere in New York, but the hotel itself was quiet. We had a shared bathroom which was fine, but as with any shared bathrooms, we sometimes had to queue and it got a bit flooded, but just go in with your flip flops and it's fine! Would definitely recommend this as a place to stay if you're on a budget. It had internet access, free maps, washing machine and a nice outside terrace to sit on.

Reviews.Title: “TINY rooms, literally a bed in a box! take earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: cityangel87
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the private rooms in the Chelsea Star for 5 nights in July. It was our first time staying in a hostel and we didn't expect anything flash, just the basics. We were greeted by extremely friendly and helpful staff at the reception desk and our check in was very smooth. The first thing we noticed when we opened the door was how ridiculously tiny the room was! It fit a double bed, but there was no room to move around, especially when we got our suitcases in. The bathrooms were very clean and we always got up early so never had to queue to use them. We got clean towels every day and I have no complaints to make about the cleanliness of the hotel or our room. I have nothing but praise for the staff at the Chelsea Star - they helped us with everything from where to go for a good night to how to use the subway system! The hotel is located on W 30th Street, just off 8th Avenue and is a great location for exploring the city. It is very close to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, and Times Square is a simple 10-15 minute walk. One of the things I do have to comment on about this hotel is the level of noise at night. There must be a nightclub located nearby, as I was kept awake every night by people fighting and shouting in the streets and it was quite scary! that was the main issue for me, so if you decide to stay here, take earplugs! I would recommend this hotel as a place to stay if you are looking for something basic and can put up with the noise on a night! I've stayed in many hostels since the Chelsea Star and have had better experiences

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room.... VERY noisy!”
Reviews.Author: YIWAN
Reviews.Content: Steep flight of metal stairs from street to hotel (situated above shops) so be prepared to struggle up with your luggage.... then found that the room we had booked for three nights was not available.... we were two friends travelling together so we had requested a room with two beds.... they INSISTED that the 'twin room' we booked meant one with ONE small double bed in it.... too late to find somewhere else.... We had the room next to the shower and toilets (shared by all rooms.....) with the American flag painted on all four walls.... when standing in the middle of the room you could reach out and TOUCH BOTH WALLS! At least we didn't feel encouraged to spend any time in the room other than to sleep.... which WAS difficult as the traffic and street noises outside our window kept getting louder as the night went on..... Clean towels were provided daily and the hotel (really just a hostel...) felt safe and in a good location, just a couple of blocks up from Penn Station. Cheap taco restaurant ($2!) nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hostel if you're expecting a hostel”
Reviews.Author: Erica_B1979
Reviews.Content: I booked this hostel for myself (British) and my american friend from California. I thought the hostel was great, she hated it. Though she did admit that it was very clean and that the staff were very friendly. Basically this is just a small room with a bed (and TV). But it doesn't have all the commodities and comfort as would have a 3-4* hotel. But as a hostel it's fantastic and way better than the London hostels or even some of the dump hole 3*hotels you can find here in London. I don't think we had the best room though (coney Island theme), the room next to us looked a lot better (sorry I don't remember room numbers!). The location is great and its very clean and staff are very helpful. Warning very central so therefore very noisy! The shared bathroom was always very clean. So if your visiting NYC and looking for a cheap but clean place to sleep after a day of visiting this is your place. If your looking for a Hotel room then look else where. I will definitely go back here, my american friend definitely not.

Reviews.Title: “Only if your DESPERATE”
Reviews.Author: Cathal M
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel on the second floor of a building that looke like a back entrance to a shop or resturant. their is no stairs so if you have alot of bags or heavy bags then your in trouble. The rooms are clean but small. the have shared bathrooms that must only be cleaned once a day as i arrived late evening about 8pm and the toilet bins was overflowing. the hotel does have outside patio that you can smoke or drink if you wish. the internet is $2 dollars for 20 minutes. overall only if you have on a budget and desperate would i say for you to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Maria59066
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful. The location was excellent, 2 min walk to trains station. Lots of good places to eat close by and you can walk to great shopping areas. The room was excellent, had everything i needed.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay, really nice staff”
Reviews.Author: flaviabass
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a dorm room, there were no lockers, but definetely it was not a problem. A little too small when the room is full because everybody gets too much luggage.. but it's ok. I met some really nice guys from Israel, Germany and Spain.. and we've had some fun together. The staff was really very nice, helpful and I have nothing to complain about that. They didn't change the linen during my whole stay, but I had taken mine, so it was ok for me as I had foreseen it. Internet for $2 (20 min), free coffee in the morning, hot water shower... I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: eileen24
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions from outside of the hotel was OH MY GOD what have we let ourselves in for, as basically it was a secured blue door with a flower stall next to it. We pressed the buzzer and was admitted into the building, I struggled up a steep flight of stairs with both my friend's case and my own as she has back problems. However there to greet us was a lovely guy on reception who couldn't be more helpful advising us on the hotel conduct and although he could not leave the desk (hence me lugging up the cases) was realy pleasant and helpful. We had room203 which was a cosy room which had a comfortable queen size bed and colour tv, air con and very clean spacious bathroom. The location is excellent and the day staff were very pleasant and helpful advising us where and where not to go. Clean towels were issued daily and plenty of toiletries were provided. There was internet access, washer, dryer, telephones, coffee making facilities down in the basement as you enter the front door to the left. All in all very good value for money, clean, friendly and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “You dont get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: R_1970
Reviews.Content: I staid here with friends because they were low on cash so they staid in a the bunk rooms they had fun even though they were accused of not paying and were woken up at 830 am by staff cleaning the room but they were happy with the $35 a night stay, i had a privet room with bath tv that only had 3 working channels no a/c and the hot water didn't work. Like i said i only staid here because i wanted to be near my friends but next time i think i will pay the difference in price for them and stay at a nicer place, if your low on cash and want to stay in a bunk room I guess this is your best bet but if your looking for a nice clean cheep place with amenities you can do better

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: littleurchin28
Reviews.Content: Stayed there numerous times in 5 years. Last time, the place seemed run down, even after remodeling. When I was there twice in the fall, they were friendly, upgraded my room and it was clean. Six months later, the room I stayed in happened to be the same one I stayed in before and it was pretty beat up. TV was broken, the paint on the walls was chipped and scuffed and the bathrooms were always a mess. Nobody helped me carry my suitcase to my room and they seemed like I was bothering them every time I asked a question at the front desk. The straw that brok the camel's back was when I went to pick up my luggage from storage after I checked out, the guy told me to get it myself! It was buried under two HUGE sports bags that weighed about 60lbs. each. I was struggling to dig my bag out and he looked right at me and didn't even offer to help after I paid $3 to have it stored. The internet service is worse than dial-up and the wireless signal continuously cuts out. I regularly stay at the Chelsea Star, but I'm questioning whether I'll ever go back. If you're going to Madison Square Garden, the location can't be beat, but I'd check out other hotels in the area first. I am extremely disappointed in the down-turn this place has taken.

Reviews.Title: “What a WONDERFUL hotel !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cookieavenue
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Chelsea star hotel for a week and it was GREAT !! The hotel is located one block away from 34 street Penn station which was very convenient because getting off the train it was easy to spot (big yellow building right at the corner of 8th ave). The Chelsea star hotel is a walk up hotel, I wish they had an elevator but that was a minor inconvenience because when we ring the door bell a young man with a Chelsea star shirt told us to walk right up and he brought our bags right up the stair case. When checking in we were greeted by the concierge which was really helpful, explaining how to get around in the city, places to go and eat and gave us discount passes to clubs and museums. We reserve a Superior room for $189 plus tax but he told us that we were getting an upgrade to a Deluxe room which was amazing. The room was very clean,comfortable and spacious but located on 8 ave which was quite noisy at times but we use ear plugs so that wasn't much of a problem. The house keepers changed our sheets everyday which was a plus. There was also a lounge area in which you can drink and eat which was very funky with all the lights. When checking out we needed help with transportation and so the front desk ordered a car to pick us up at the hotel and they also stored our bags for a fee of $2 dollars for big bags. I recommend this hotel to those who are looking for a discount and great service and great location, def will book again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best For The Budget!”
Reviews.Author: redbearwa
Reviews.Content: Absolutely my favorite hotel in New York City! If you are going to NYC on a budget . Located, just across Madison Square Garden,Penn station and the A C E subway lines. It's central to broadway and shopping areas.Although small in size, the unique themed rooms make up for alot! Great Staff cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: tumbleweeds023
Reviews.Content: Reviews on Tripadvisor were generally so positive that we thought we'd give this place a try. We checked in with no problem after booking on-line and requesting a quiet room because we were just getting back from a really, really long flight. The man at the desk told us that he upgraded us from a double room to a queen en suite at the same price, which was really nice. The room turned out to be very, very quiet, clean and comfortable - for the price, actually, it was a great deal! The bed was comfortable, the bathroom had all the amenities and it had a good, safe feel about it. That morning, there was a pot of coffee on the main level for guest's use, and breakfast was just a minute away by foot. Location was excellent - less than 2 blocks from Penn Station and very convenient to many restaurants, it's in a lively part of the city. The only negative that I could give it was having to haul our considerable luggage up a narrow flight of stairs to the check-in area and up a second narrow flight of stairs to the room. But all things considered, that was a very minor inconvenience!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing major to complain about, what a deal! Great staff too!”
Reviews.Author: oregongirl
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget. The Chelsea Star has a great location just a few blocks from Penn station and every hub you want to connect to, plus it is a short walk up to 34 avenue from 30th and from there, great shopping, access to Times square, old diners, etc. My husband and I stayed here for a few days while visiting our son and while he attended Comicon. We requested a superior room in a quiet area (we had room 304) which comes with its own bathroom complete with tub/shower. Our room was exceptionally clean and comfortable, basic but what else do you need? Our bath was tiled in blue and yellow, kept very clean. We did have to request two extra towels and pillows as you get just the basics, but we requested extra and picked them up at the front desk and it was not a problem. Like all the other linens and bedding, they were very clean. Each day our bed was changed and made up and bath cleaned, etc.. Part of the hotel is a hostel, but if you want privacy and your own bath, the superior room is the way to go. Cost? Inexpensive for two people in NYC at only $119 before tax per night. The front desk clerks were helpful and kind and the two we spoke with went out of their way to help us out. There is a faint odor of pizza through the building, I think it is because there is a microwave in one area where people constantly warm up slices of NY pizza, and the walls are not soundproof--we could hear the people upstairs stomping on the floor in the middle of the night, but it wasn't that big of a deal. As for mice--not a sign of them. We had food in our room and wastebaskets with food containers and scraps and no signs of mice. I think it depends on the part of the building you go to. When we return to NYC, we will definitely stay here again, but if you want luxury, large rooms, room service, with a high price tag, this isn't going to be your pick.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price in New York CIty”
Reviews.Author: parkoSydney
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel in NYC for 5 people without having to get 2 hotel rooms and we found this gem. Location is great, not far off 34th st area and surrounded by subway stops. The apartment we had was on the top floor of the annex building next door and was 3 flights of narrow stairs up which was the only down side. On arrival they organised some guys to help us up with our luggage. The apt was really big and we had plenty of room for 4 teens + 1 adult and lots of luggage. Kitchen basic but great for breakky and snacks. TV mostly had great reception and the heating was good - too good sometimes and we had to leave windows open a bit and the apt was cleaned daily. We didnt need the hotel staff for advise so I cant say either way on that but for the price it was a great place to spend a week.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and central, but cheap for a reason”
Reviews.Author: Funktious
Reviews.Content: If you're on a budget but want to stay in central New York then you could do worse than the Chelsea Star, but there's a reason it's cheap! Good points first; wonderfully central, friendly staff, lots of tourist information scattered around, internet in the lobby. Our deluxe room was large and clean and we felt safe. The down side however, was the noise from 5th Avenue, which yes, you have to expect from such a central location but was incredibly difficult to sleep through. And then there was the mouse... I must reiterate, the room was definitely clean, but having some chocolate in a bag on the sofa, we soon discovered that New York mice have an incredible sense of smell and spent an entertaining 20 minutes in the middle of the night chasing a mouse out of the room! And that's the attitude you need for the Chelsea Star; you're staying in central New York for a pittance, so it's worth putting up with the noise and potential mice! If you don't think you can, then book somewhere a bit more expensive or further out.

Reviews.Title: “Dumped on Street!”
Reviews.Author: mannswiss
Reviews.Content: Chelsea Star dumped us on the street at midnight! We had to find another place to sleep! Read below for the story. Pros of the Chelsea Star: Relatively Clean Location Cons of the Chelsea Star: Noisy all night from the traffic of a very busy 8th Ave. - and low quality windows/insulation of the room They messed up our reservation, dumped us on the street, and didn't take any responsibility for their mistake, they didn't even offer an apology. Our experience: Our original reservation was for a 4 night stay for 8 people occupying an entire 8 person dorm room. We were able to secure very good cheap tickets to the broadway show “Wicked” the day after our original checkout date. We called and changed the reservation to a 5 night stay. We made a follow up call about a month later to confirm that the reservation had indeed been extended to include that 5th night. Both times we called, to change the reservation and then to confirm the reservation change, we were assured that everything was fine and that the 5th night (dates were reiterated) was reserved. When the first part of our group arrived in Manhattan and tried to check in they were not allowed to because they were too early (even though we had asked the Chelsea Star in advance that it be alright for us to come that early). The did let us leave our bags behind the check-in desk but no paperwork or payment was processed. When the second part of our group arrived (different flight) and checked in Chelsea Star would not let us do so unless we paid for the entire group. So a member of this smaller group who was not the head of our group and subsequently did not make the reservation paid with a credit card. Chelsea Star did not collect any contact information nor did they provide us any paperwork outlining reservation details or such. Being jet-lagged and tired and overwhelmed by the busyness of the city and assuming we were dealing with a responsible company we did not verify that what we had there is what we actually had reserved (it would have been wise for us to verify that Chelsea Star had not messed up our reservation). We enjoyed our vacation until on the 5th night we returned to Chelsea Star at approximately 11:30 PM and we found all of our belongings in plastic bags mixed together and piled on top of each other in a storage room. The Chelsea Star front desk staff member informed us that our room was now occupied by other people and we needed to get out. We were kicked out on the street with our belongings in garbage bags at almost midnight to find somewhere to sleep. So we ended up dragging our our belongings a few blocks down the street to the Chelsea International Hostel where they had vacancy (per the Chelsea Star staff member). Needless to say the stress and fear of not knowing where to go for shelter in the middle of the night, along with the late hour of the night, we did not have a good night sleep, we were stressed beyond belief, agitated at each other, and had a miserable time the next day. It really ruined our overall experience. After the vacation (and as we were getting kicked out) when we tried to talk to the Chelsea Star staff and manager we got a very aggressive and derogatory response from them that basically told us that they had done nothing wrong, we were at fault, and they frankly didn't care – they had our money and good riddance; go find somewhere else to sleep. We understand that mistakes happen. They made the mistake of messing up our reservation, we didn't catch their mistake. We would have appreciated them doing all they could to make up for it. We didn't expect them to kick out other guests – that isn't fair to the other guests who did nothing wrong. It would have been professional if they had found us another place to stay, given us time and space to pack up our things, arranged for transportation to the new place to stay, offered an apology for the mistake, paid for our stay elsewhere, and/ or refunded some or all of our cost of our stay. (Any single one or combination of these things would have been much better than – get out “I don't want to have to deal with this at midnight” - and we do have an audio recording of the staff member saying that to us). (I personally own my own business and when I make a mistake I do everything that I can to make it right. It is the right thing to do and I care about my customers. Not good business practices to act like the Chelsea Star did at the time of our stay and since then.) As you can tell if you are reading this review we still have very strong feelings about how we were treated and how it effected our time in New York (5 months later). Our recommendation is to find another place to stay that care about their guests and not just about their money, that have the means to take care of emergencies, that stand up and face their mistakes, that don't take the attitude in the end of good riddance get out of our hotel. (Update: Before posting this review I emailed it to the Chelsea Star Hotel and gave them a chance to do something about it. It has been almost 4 weeks now and I have received no reply from them, another indication that they do not care about their customers and have no problem treating people poorly.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: MrsGable
Reviews.Content: I went with three friends and we stayed in the apartment suite. Our room was very clean and the hotel staff was very helpful. The only problems were the noise from the street and our room was very hot. While this is a wonderful place to stay due to location and the availability of parking garages ( a bit expensive, call ahead to find local garages), I do not know if I would recommend it to someone in their 30s. This is a perfect spot for someone in their 20s who wants a safe, clean, inexpensive stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: bluechick33
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Star is very centrally located, just across Madison Square Garden, and within walking distance to many major sights. A walk to Times Square is about 15 min, Macy's 5 mins. I even walked to the Cheyenne's Diner for yummy pancakes. The room was much smaller than I thought, I can't even open my luggage. Definitely not for claustrophobics. But by the 2nd day, I'm used to it. The shared bathrooms were usually empty and very clean. You can book the van that brings you to the airport from the front desk. Free internet at lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hostel”
Reviews.Author: dedji
Reviews.Content: Chelsea Star is in a very good location, has very nice staff, clean rooms,and the price for only 10 streets away from times square, is not the worst. I definitely recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not NY's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: Monkey0810
Reviews.Content: The location of the Chelsea Star is perfect - next to Madison Square Gardens and Penn Station. You can walk to the Empire State Building and 5th. However, after staying at the Chelsea International Hostel the night before, we felt it represented poor value for money. A private double, with shared bathroom is $130 per night; 10 blocks down the road, you can get the same for only $85 (and you get a sink in the room). The shared bathroom was always in use and you had to queue to get in. At night it was also really noisy. If you don't mind a bit of a walk or a bit extra on the Subway - go with the Chelsea International.

Reviews.Title: “Just about OK”
Reviews.Author: ChristianNS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in a couple of months. Once in a Double with its own bathroom, and once in a double with shared bathroom. The hotel is in a great location, 5 minutes walk from Train/Metro station. It is very easy to get to from both JFK and Newark airport. On the downside it is very noisy. There is a lose drain cover on the road outside the hotel, and it makes a lot of noise every time a car driver over it. On the ground floor the noise was very annoying. The dulux room was a lot better, and had a decent wall mounted AC unit, which kept the room cool. In the normal double, the AC unit was a window mounted one located about 6 inches from the pillow of the double bed. It was too small for the room, and couldn't keep it cool, but big enough to cause neck-ache by blowing on your head. There are too many rooms sharing the bathrooms for my liking. As a summary: Good for a few nights, but don't expect to get the best nights sleep. It is cheap, and ideal for the city, and generally clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price you pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: Clara1234
Reviews.Content: The dormitory is incredibly clean, including the bathroom, we had air conditioning and the people at the desk were correct.
