You can have a nice chat in the common area, but that gets a little too noisy for the people inside the dormitory that's just by it. Overall, I'd recommend it, great location, price and accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique”
Reviews.Author: veggiecat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chelsea Star last week. We had tickets to a show at Madison Square Garden and couldn’t have asked for a more convenient location! The Chelsea is right across the street! There is ample parking near by although it’s pretty pricey. (Probably reasonable for NYC though) There are also many restaurants to choose from within a couple of blocks in different price ranges to suit any budget. We were on a tight budget for our trip so we needed something reasonable but NOT a fleabag. The Chelsea fit the bill perfectly. We stayed in one of their “superior” rooms with a private bath. The décor was hip and cute and the room was very clean if a bit “cozy”. The staff was very pleasant and helpful as well. If you are looking for luxurious amenities this hotel is not for you. But, they provided enough basics including WIFI service that we didn’t mind not having the 4-star experience. We had read that one of the few complaints was that the location is noisy. It is, (Hey! It’s New York City!) however, we had no problem getting a good night’s rest. All-in-all the experience was very pleasant. We would recommend the Chelsea and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: angwri
Reviews.Content: I find it difficult to grade this place. As a hostel it is very good, but as a hotel only OK. The location is convenient for Penn Station & Madison Square Garden. The area is OK (but I wouldn't want to venture much further west). I came in on my own after midnight & it was fine, as there are always lots of people around. I had booked a single room with shared bathroom at a cost of $115 per night. The bed was surprisingly comfy (despite the plastic mattress cover). The bedding & towels were clean. I never had to queue for the bathroom & always found it to be clean. The TV had a TV & chest of drawers (no hanging space). It was painted in a vile yellow colour & did feel a little "cell-like". The stairs & doors were all metal & added to the prison feel. The reception & courtyard were pleasant. I found all the members of staff to be very polite & helpful. I will have been one of the older residents (mid 40s) but I found all the kids staying there to be quiet & considerate. However, I cannot reiterate how much street noise there is in the area (all night long). Nothing much you can do about it-it's New York!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Driftingkiwi
Reviews.Content: Booked a couple of nights here with only a few days notice - options for cheap accomodation in NYC are always limited, never mind anywhere worth staying in summer at short notice, so I wasn't really expecting much... but my expectations were definitely exceeded! As other reviewers have mentioned, reception is up a flight of stairs - I was carrying a pack so no issues there, but if you're looking for elevators and a concierge service, best find somewhere else. No hassles at check-in. I was staying in the cheapest option ($89 + tax per night, single room with shared bathroom) - the room was very small, with a noisy air-conditioner and quite a bit of road noise, so ear plugs are a must. Seriously though, when you're staying in such a central location in NYC, a bit of noise has to be expected, surely? Bathroom was generally kept clean, so no complaints. I wouldn't have wanted to spend all day in my room just because of the size, but given that I was out all day and night (hey this is New York after all!), it was absolutely fine. I liked the place enough to book another couple of nights for a few days later on my way back through New York - this time I booked a double room as no singles were available, for an extra $20/night. Was very pleased to find when I got back that I'd been upgraded to a double room with it's own bathroom at no charge - this was a lovely clean room, queen bed, very spacious, with a spotless bathroom. Wireless internet access worked fine for me, until my laptop hard drive died at least... So much to see and do within a few blocks - can also highly recommend stopping in for a pint or two at the Molly Wee, an Irish bar just over the road from the hotel. Overall, highly recommended if you want a room at a reasonable price (for NYC) in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: yoyiFlorida
Reviews.Content: The price for the type of room and location was very good considering how expensive hotels in manhattan are. We stayed in the superios suit and the service was very good. Only downside is that the building has no elevator...and the stairs are very tight

Reviews.Title: “Great Locaton & Clean, but bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: loislane101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in early June in a Superior Room and were fairly pleased with it. The rooms are small, but very clean. My only complaint would be that the walls are a little too thin. Thank goodness for air conditioning in more ways than one. Several rooms seem to have hardwood floors, which greatly increases the noise level within the hotel. Very convenient to Penn Station, only one long block, and we never felt uncomfortable walking back to the hotel, no matter the time and our cards worked every time. The patio was a nice space to relax in. The free wi-fi was very weak and kept cutting out, so a bit frustrating. The staff is okay, not as friendly as I would have liked, but it WAS in the middle of a heat wave (98 degrees), so maybe that made the difference (giving them the benefit of the doubt). They always answered all our questions in a courteous manner.

Reviews.Title: “Intense decor!”
Reviews.Author: maevedave
Reviews.Content: Great value - we payed $99 for the room per night, which worked out very cheap between two, especially with the current strength of the pound against the dollar. Plus points - We had booked a room with a shared bathroom and got upgraded to an ensuite. The room was clean and bright, if a little bit small and totally lacking in storage space for clothes. Bathroom was a good size, clean, plenty of hot water. Great location, near Penn station if you need to get a cab, easy enough to walk to Greenwich village, lots of drugstores, bakeries, off licenses near-by too. Downsides - Very noisy at night! Not so much other guests in the hotel as noise from the street, no soundproofing on the windows so you can hear everything. There is a also a less than salubrious 'bikini bar' right next door so it can be a bit dodgy coming back at night, especially given the fact that the card you are meant to swipe in with often doesn't work and you have to ring the bell. Staff aren't exactly incredibly helpful (although they are friendly enough). Not a lot of internet access for such a big place, and no real communal area for guests to hang out in. There is a roof terrace guests can use, but this is really only a bonus in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: fruchick
Reviews.Content: I was in the unfortunate position of not being able to get a room at my first, second, or third choice of hotels for a Saturday night in the city. In need of simply a place to rest my head for the night, I booked a dorm room at the Chelsea Star, thinking I would check the place out for a potential week-long stay in a full-size private room this summer. I didn't much want to be there to start with, but I think the front desk staff wanted me there even less. When I checked in I was in a time-bind (had to be at a class nearby in 15 minutes), and the woman in line to check in just infront of me was ultra sweet and let me cut ahead. The woman behind the desk, though, thought this meant she could take her sweet old time. The archaic check-in system is a joke. I also realized during this time that the delightful meaty smell permeating the building was from the Subway restaurant downstairs. I had requested a bottom bunk when making the reservation, which they of course did not accommodate. There are also NO lockers in the rooms, and I didn't trust leaving my belongings in the "lobby" (more on that later). So me and my laptop, camera, and iPod traveled together for the remainder of the day and evening. These are MIXED dorm rooms, and as I woman I will never put myself into that situation again. Disgusting, loud men made up the bulk of my roommates, and the guys on each side of me snored all night. The window faced 8th Ave, which was added noise. The bathrooms... yikes. I figured I would stay cleaner if I DIDN'T shower in the morning. I checked out as early as humanly possible. A few people ahead of me did the same, and they complained to one of the staff members that the bathroom in THEIR dorm room also did not have a hook or anything to put clothes on -- so they had to put their clean clothes on the bathroom floor. I involuntarily shuddered at the thought. The staff member just said "yeah". Nice. Soon, there was nobody in the front desk area except me and one staff member, and when I sat down on one of the two long padded benches and pulled out my laptop, the following exchange took place: "Are you waiting for a cab service?" "Uh, no." "Then what are you waiting for?" "Waiting for my laptop to start up so I can check my email." "Well, you can't sit there." "I'm sorry??" "You have to go to the lobby." "What is THIS?" "Not the lobby. Go down the hall and take a left." He seriously shoo'd me out of the empty check-in area and made me sit in a tiny, dirty room (spilled coffee and sugar *everywhere*) with internet kiosks, and nowhere to set down my laptop. But I wasn't there for long -- all the wifi connections security-enabled, and no password posted or provided to me. So I consider that "free-wifi" advertised on their website a myth. Needless to say, I won't be booking a room there for my week in August.

Reviews.Title: “Both excellent and horrible. Read on to find out why.”
Reviews.Author: lombaxian
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel twice. Once I was in a normal hotel room, one with its own bathroom so it was one of their higher end models. The other time I got one of their hostel dorm beds. First of all the hotel part: This is a clean place, just great. It was a great sized room and a great sized bathroom, considering you are in New York. The shower was large and even had a seat in it. I've seen $300 rooms that were smaller in this city. The room had a nice big TV and DVD player and we were more than satisfied. The area inside the hotel was cute and colorful. At this low price, you can't beat the quality, the amazing location, and the simple bang for your buck. It's tops. Now for the hostel part, with the bunk beds: This also is a clean part of the hotel. The bunk beds are located in small apartment units that have been converted to dorm rooms. I did notice mold on the ceiling of the bathroom but that is not a huge deal in my eyes. But there were some glaring problems that are not quality-related. First of all, the staff used our room as a hallway, literally. Literally. I can't stress that enough. The supply closet was in our room and also it was an entrance to the backyard and other places. So at 9am you would have a staffer come right in and pass through or rustle through the closet. They would not knock. This was not an isolated incident, this happened every 30 minutes to an hour on every day of the 3 days we stayed. They would not lock the door when they did this and if we locked the door they would unlock it. This is unprecedented. I have never been in a hotel or hostel where the staff simply barged into your room at all times of the day. Secondly, there is no lobby or other room indoors to hang out. This is a hostel so you have many strangers in a room together. You need a way to get out of the room to relax so you won't bother people. But unless you are staying during good weather and sit down outside (and only during the day), you will be stuck in the room, unable to do much of anything like talk or read or use your computer because of your sleeping roommates. Thirdly, since you are in a dorm situation with 9 strangers in a room, it would actually be beneficial to keep the bathroom out of the room and put several bathrooms in the hallways for the whole floor. This is not the case. The bathrooms are in your room. So when you wake up, prepare to wait 2 hours just to empty your bladder as every single one of your 9 roommates will be in line for it. If you have a bad bladder, you'd best go somewhere else. Get yourself 2 roomies or more and rent out one of the higher end rooms and skip the dorm beds. If you want dorm beds, go someplace else unless your party can fill all 10 beds in a room. If that is the case then by all means, since this is the cleanest hostel I've ever seen in New York, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm.....”
Reviews.Author: medcat3
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? I have a hard time writing a negative review for the Chelsea Star mainly because it is such a bargain for the price. I booked directly through the hotel's website and got the $79/night deal! That being said, for some reason, the Chelsea Star was just, well, ...average. Bathroom and washroom facilities are shared. The other people staying on my floor were not particularly tidy and, at times, the bathrooms were not that clean. This is not the hotel's fault. I was, however, disappointed by the fact that my room only got 4 television stations. 2 of the 4 stations were the exact same one. One station was in Spanish and the last was HBO. Sometimes CBS would come in clear and other times it would not. This may not be a big deal to some people but I enjoy going to new places and watching local news and other city broadcasts after a long day of touring. As far as Wi Fi, I could not log on to the hotel's Wi Fi from my room. Free Wi Fi may only be available on the hotel's first floor. There are pay-by-the minute computers and printers available in the lobby that have access to the internet. The truly redeeming aspects of this hotel are the front desk staff and the location. The hotel is literally one block from Madison Square Garden and the Subway. I walked to 2 Knicks games during my stay. It is just a few blocks walk to Times Square. I felt very safe not only around the hotel but in Manhattan in general. Nice police presence. Overall, I recommend the Chelsea Star for its unbeatable price and location. However, it may be worth it for some people to spend a few more dollars per night for reliable television and private bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place¬”
Reviews.Author: Kugsy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are aged 27. We booked to go to NY for a week so didnt want to spend loads on a hotel as trust me some were so expensive!! Anyway found the Chelsea Star Hotel on the internet. Price you cant beat it. Location was fantastic. I read all the reviews on here before I booked so thought we should write what we thought as I know alot of people rely on these! We flew into JFK and got the tube non stop to the subway at Pennsylvania station and first thing we saw was the Emprise State Building - wow. We walked to the hotel and only took about 4/5mins - slow pace :o) so I would definitely recommend the tube! The hotel front is literally just a door off the road and when you get buzzed in you walk up big flight of stairs (if you need help just let reception know and they would send someone down) Anyway we got buzzed in and went up to reception. Lovely blonde lady checked us in. We had booked a double room with shared bathroom however the lady said would we mind staying in the room for 3 nights then be upgraded to a private double with ensuite at no extra charge - we didnt mind at all. The shared room was on ground floor, very small just double bed and a single open wardrobe and TV on the wall so did wonder where I was going to put all my shopping. However it was fine. Shared bathrooms were clean and they are on every floor so if one was busy then you just go upstairs. I kept leaving my shampoos etc in the showers but as they are constantly cleaned I never saw them again so make sure you dont leave anything! I used to just go the toilet in my pyjamas no one cared! The private doubles was a lot nicer, it was on the second floor. Room was large with table/dresser big wardrobes and of course the ensuite bathroom. I must admit the private room with shared bathroom was good for first couple of days but i think if going for a whole week I would definitely book private double room with ensuite just for the space and cosyness. All in all I would recommed this hotel to all. Yes you are on a busy road but to be honest what Manhatton hotel is not? It never woke us up anyway but hey maybe we arnt as fussy as some people on here!!?? You do get what you pay for... We found reception always helpful, We booked a helicopter trip with them, the Greyhounds tour 48hr is well worth doing at start of trip as you get to see everything. Macys is only 10min walk from hotel and dont forget to go claim your discount card if you are from outside the US at the service desk that you can use on all purchases for 3 months! If we went back to NY we would defnitely stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea Star - Great location”
Reviews.Author: munnke
Reviews.Content: Great location, slap bang in the centre of Chelsea means you can walk anyway within Manhatten in about 20 minutes. Staff are very helpful and the apartment we had was ok. Cleaning staff were very efficient each day (but wouldn't make beds if you left personal belongings in it). Our apartment was at the front of the building on the second floor and we needed ear plugs to drown out street noise at weekend. Also heating was unreliable and came on at strange times. We were cold occasionally at night.

Reviews.Title: “More like chelsea one star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonymelbourne123
Reviews.Content: The room was decribed a newly renovated.... a coat of paint and the bed was the only thing that was new. We where on the top floor at the front of the building, it was very noisy. The window did not even close properly. The staff where not very helpfull and rude, we had to ask for; The heating to be fixed: they would not fix our heating we asked numerous times for it to be fixed as we had none. The only solution was to give us a plug in bar heater. ( it was below 45F for all of our stay) The TV aerial to be connected to the socket as it needed to be rewired, in the end we did it our self. Housekeeping did noy give us towels which we had to ask for more than once. It was a chore to get them to do anything for us and at times they where just rude. WIFI internet was free but hardly worked.

Reviews.Title: “pretty decent place”
Reviews.Author: wolfatron
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are looking for a wheelchair accessible place, this is not for you. Otherwise, read on. The hotel is located at the corner of an intersection (30th and 8th) and it doesn't really look like a hotel from the outside (looks like it's connected to a convenience store) so be careful if you are driving and looking for it. Once you find the hotel's door, you need to get buzzed in and then climb a flight ot steps to get to the front desk. This might be tricky for those of you who have heavy luggage or multiple suitcases. But once you get past that it's pretty good. I booked a triple room at the Chelsea Star for three nights but before I left for New York, I heard about a huge snowstorm that was going to hit the U.S. and Canada on the night I was supposed to be leaving. I called Chelsea Star and told them that I might be delayed because of the storm, and I was told that my reservation would be honored even if I arrived a day late. I was supposed to arrive on a Monday, but the storm pushed my arrival to Tuesday, so I told the hotel that if they wanted, they could rent out the room for Monday night. When I arrived at the hotel on Tuesday, I was told no one had recorded that I was going to be arriving late and that my triple room had been taken. I was very distraught, but fortunately, the guy at the desk was very nice and he said that the Chelsea Star would upgrade my reservation and put my friends and I in an apartment suite and only charge me the triple room price. I forgot to ask the check-in guy's name but he's a soft-spoken Caucasian man with curly-ish black hair. If you want great service, go to him. He made suggestions for transportation (where to go to use the subway, what kind of metro cards he thought we might need) and pointed out a few things we could do (ie. take the free Staten Island Ferry to see the Statue of Liberty). He also suggested a decent nearby breakfast place :) You can also ask for Lilah. She's very nice too. But I wouldn't recommend talking to one of the night-staffers (guy with a Russian accent). He wasn't exactly rude, but he seemed bored/ disinterested, which isn't something you really want in a customer-oriented business. Before I left for New York, I spoke to this guy on the phone about being delayed because of the weather and he wanted to charge me for arriving on Tuesday instead of Monday, even though I had already explained to him that I had called the hotel about the situation the day before. I can understand it if a hotel charges me for being late or for cancelling if I call the day before or on the day that I am supposed to be checking in, but I informed Chelsea Star about the situation two days before I was supposed to arrive, which is their deadline before they start charging cancellation fees. But I found everything and everyone else to be quite good :) The hotel was located in a good place, just steps from Penn Station. The apartment suite is actually in the building next to the hotel. My friends and I stayed in room 1N, which was on the first floor and facing the street. The room itself was pretty good (2 double beds, private bath, small tv, kitchenette with sink, microwave, mini fridge, cups, plates, utensils) but in the early morning, noise from the street did wake me up sometimes but I tend to be a light sleeper. The room was comfortable and clean and gave you what you needed. I checked for bed bugs and I was happy to see that there were none (mattresses were wrapped in plastic to prevent bug infestation). Housekeeping also showed up each day to tidy up, and hot water and pressure were pretty good in the shower. The only drawback I really have to say is that heating for our room was very strange. It was generally ok, but at night, sometimes it became very hot, and we had to crack open the window while we slept. I'd stay here again, but I think it's because I lucked out with the apartment suite. I'm not sure how things are for people who stay single, double, triple and quad rooms. I checked out the shared bathrooms near the front desk and thought they were ok. There were two rooms with only a toilet (clean but only enough room to sit down on the toilet) and one room that has a toilet and a shower (it's a private room made for one person). There's 2 computers near the front desk, which costs $2 U.S. for 20 minutes. One of these computers is in a small room. You can get coffee and hot water in there in the morning but don't expect it to be a common room, because it's sort of small. But there's a little rack in the room that offers cards that describe NYC restaurant and attractions. It's a good resource if you're not sure about what to do. All in all, I had a good time at Chelsea Star and I would recommend this place (or I guess the apartment suite) to other student travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Place !”
Reviews.Author: Leafly
Reviews.Content: This hotel/hostel is a 10 minute walk from Time Square ! The best part is that when you fly into JFK you can take the 30 minute ($12) Long Island Rail Road to Penn Station and then the hotel is a 2 minute walk. We booked a Superior room at $199 a night, the room was spotlessly clean, the bathroom was brand new and the staff were really helpful. I had read the hotel was in a dodgy neighbourhood but we did not find that the case at all. The walls are like paper you can hear noises from the rooms above and next door to you but if you are in New York to shop and go out, it really doesn't matter. I highly recommend this hotel for the budget traveller !

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place- would go back”
Reviews.Author: aberdeenlass1903
Reviews.Content: Booked this place not knowing what to expect but was delighted when we saw our room. We booked a suit with bathroom and we were fortunate to get a room at the back of the hotel (room 405) so very little noise. The room was very clean and was cleaned everyday. We were there for 5 days but by the end of the week the maids had actually just left our new clean folded sheets on our bed as we do not like the tightly tucked in sheets and pull them off when we get in!!! It was nice to know that they were getting used to our habbits!! I did get a glimpse of room 105 which was the NYC themed room and YES it was small but it was nice and clean. To give you an idea- the double bed was against the wall and you can only get in from one side- but this room was used to store our luggage when we left so it is spacious enough!! I did also take a look at the bathrooms which are shared and they are very nice. They are all tiled and have a modern look and most importantly CLEAN!! I only saw the bathroom occupied once when I was passing so it doesnt seem to be a problem sharing. This place is really central and a real bargain for manhattan! We will definately consider going back should be return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, inexpensive hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rowdy921
Reviews.Content: I booked one of the apartments for a three-day stay. The location was perfect, and we loved the room. We had two queen beds, a kitchenette, and a newly remodeled bathroom. There is a lot of street noise throughout the night, and since we were on the street level, we could hear trucks, taxis, emergency vehicles, and people on the street. We weren't bothered by it though. I would stay here again. The price was much less expensive than the "uptown" hotels, and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful inexpensive apartment suite”
Reviews.Author: Austintogo
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff in office! Very satisfied with choice. Rooms clean and spacious. Great location to see the sights and close to Penn Station. Across the street from a bakery that serves an excellent cup of coffee. Only complaint is the uneven steps that we took to go up to our room. If you stay in the suites pay attention as you climb up the steps to your room as several people in our party tripped going up the steps. The stairs are not exactly the same height.

Reviews.Title: “I Love NY”
Reviews.Author: Ludichrissy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chelsea Star, in a Superior Room Thursday - Saturday. Having read a lot of reviews I was sort of nervous going in. Any fears I had quickly subsided. I knew to expect a small entrance and non flashy exterior. Upon arrival, in a rainstorm, we had to be buzzed into the hotel. (After you get your room key you have instant access and do not need to be buzzed in and out.) You are greeted by a flight of stairs. At the top of the stairs there is a registration office. The people in the office were busy, but very polite. The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was spotless. The bed not so much on the comfy side. I asked for extra towels and pillows and they were quicky, and politely, delivered. The cleaning staff was professional, polite and very cheery. The roof deck was quite nice and comfortable. There are a few tables, with large umbrellas. The room was directly facing 8th ave. There was ample air conditioning which wasn't used too much because it went from hot to cool while we were in town. It is a busy area so there was a lot of traffic and noise. Being from a city and now living in the suburbs, it was wonderful! I welcomed the noise and was able to sleep easily for once. Admittedly we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel but when we were there we had no complaints. This location was convenient to everything. A block to the subway. A block to the train station. Close to MSG. Close to Macy's. Such a variety of restaurants and cheap but yummy eats. Mexican, Pizza, 24 hour Deli, Thai, BBQ, Burgers, and Irish Pub, all within one block. I felt very safe. The streets were always busy and there were always a lot of people around. We plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in NY!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Saretta
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, in a very good location (near time Square, Empire state building, pennysilvania station, near the 34th street). Our room ( asuperior room) was clean, with a large bathroom, air conditioner, flat tv. We had towels changed every day. The staff is helpful, friendly (there is also a girl who speaks italian!): you can use the pc (with 2 dollars you can surf for 20 min. the Net); there's a nice terrace where you can smoke, have breakfast or lunch or everything you want. This is a very good position, central and near the subway (thre's a big station under madison square garden(Penn station) where you can take metro or trains going to Washington, ecc). This is a good solution for people who want to visit the city and not stay in the hotel all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: sarahufl
Reviews.Content: Planned a long weekend in the city with girlfriends from college. All of us were recent graduates, so money was an issue. There were 6 of us traveling together so we booked a suite. We paid somewhere between $120 and $150 a night, I can't remember exactly. We were all plesantly suprised by the accomodations. The room was huge, had 2 beds, a full kitchen, a nice bathroom and a large closet. The wood floors were nice and clean, clean bedding and towels. We obviously didn't spend much time in the room as we were there to site see and party. But the time we spent there was very enjoyable. A few small complaints- the neighborhood is a little sketchy, so avoid walking outside alone in the dark, the door was very difficult to lock and unlock and required wiggling and jostling to get it open and closed. It was a bit hot, since there was no AC. Also, the street noise is very loud, especially since we were on the ground floor. We were awakened by bickering drag queens right outside of our window at about 5am, where they proceeded to scream for several hours. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Very good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: DJHSutherland
Reviews.Content: My 1st ever stay in a hostel and I was quite suprised. It was very clean, they have a small communual area to meet random people. Its a small place, some of the staff can't be bothered but others are helpful. Id reccomend it to people but everyone has different expectations and standards. It's smack bang in the middle of everything with subways 1 to 3 blocks away that go in all the directions you need. I stayed in 2 shared rooms, 1 was a lot bigger and bettre but at the end of the day a clean bed is all you need, if your tall stay away from the top bunks..Shared room had showers that were cleanded daily. Again one was a lot better than the other but both of a good standard.

Reviews.Title: “huge room, clean place, but loud street noise”
Reviews.Author: wendals
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights (thurs, fri & sat). it's clean and the staff were very friendly. we booked a superior room. the room was HUGE with a big private bathroom. #401. comfortable king size bed and a pull out sofabed. the sofa was comfy to sit & lay on. but when opened up to the bed it was really uncomfortable, like laying directly on the bar/springs. there was a/c in the room which was great cuz it was extremely hot while we were in nyc. our only real complaint was the noise level from outside. our windows faced 8th ave and since it's on the corner of 30th street it's extremely noisy at all times of the day. non-stop horn honking, sirens or people (there are 3 or 4 bars/pubs/clubs in the area which are open til 4am!). we had earplugs but it didn't help much. i'm told since this is nyc you'll get noise no matter where you stay but it was too much for me so be prepared if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little place...would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: stephrj76
Reviews.Content: When I called the hotel directly, they advised they had no more doubles. So I went to hostelbookers.com and found a double with shared bath for $49.50pp +tax. I booked the room and made sure to call the hotel directly before I left for vacation to make sure they had my reservation....and they did. :-) When we got to the hotel, I was pleased to see that the front door was locked and secure. We had to buzz the office to let us in....but once you get your room key, that will let you in. The stairs were steep going up to the front desk, but the staff was friendly and helpful. We checked in and went up more stairs to our room. This hotel has no elevator/lift, but other than the first set of stairs, they aren't too bad. We had a double bed, and the room was tiny, but it worked for us since we only stayed one night. There was a window that looked out onto the street, and there was also a window A/C unit that worked perfectly fine....which was awesome because the night we arrived was very muggy. The only downside, was that there was a big gap between the window and the A/C unit which let A LOT of road noise in...but we managed to drown it out enough to get to sleep. The room itself was very clean along with the bedding and towels that were provided. The bathroom down the hall was surprisingly clean...considering we were sharing it with others, and we had no problem getting in when we needed to. The rooftop terrace that is mentioned, isn't really what it seems. I thought there would be a view, but there isn't because it's situated in the middle of the surrounding buildings. It's nice to hang out on, but it really offers no view. All in all, I really liked this hotel and would definitely stay again. It's in a great central location and it's not nearly as spendy as all the other NY hotels. And if you have problems finding availability, check hostelbookers.com or another website as the hotels usually "sell" a number of rooms to diff. websites. Feel free to email if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “great and fun!”
Reviews.Author: gelavie
Reviews.Content: great and fun place to stay. centraly located and nice people. can recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea star a little oasis within a big city”
Reviews.Author: cj22cj22
Reviews.Content: Spent a night in private room, very clean, very unique, very much a memorable visit. location is ideal within 10 blocks of times square, 2 blocks of madison square gardens and a leasurely stoll down to greenwich village. perfect. staff were friendly and helpful, the recent terrace is a welcome addition to the hotel providing somehwere cool to rest your weary feet after a day sightseeing. would use this hotel every time i visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in NY!”
Reviews.Author: celine&yanni
Reviews.Content: Obsiously the best deal in NY! The hotel rooms are small but confortable and clean and the manager is very helpful and professional...and cute also! This hotel being located midtown is at walking distance of everything there is to see in NY and in a very animated area. Lots to do around. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. I especially appreciated the terrace at the back where you can sit and relax , with the trees of the neighbouring gardens, a feeling of quiet and nature in the heart of the city. Will definitely go back there as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “The Closet”
Reviews.Author: teentravlr
Reviews.Content: The room was the size of a closet and it had a hideous mural of the Wizard of Oz. The shared bathroom in the hall was dirty the whole time we were there. The neighborhood was rough and not very conviently located. We switched hotels and cancelled part of our stay because it was so bad.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: littlebird_7
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, lovely and clean rooms, helpful and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: JBen
Reviews.Content: My daughter (25) and I were off to New York for shopping, Broadway and dining, therefore didn't want to spend our entire budget on accommodation. After much research we stayed at the Chelsea Star and were thrilled. The rooms were clean and the superior we stayed in was adequate size, with a large bathroom. Big enough for two women to get ready for a night on the town. We are walkers and the location couldn't be better. On the occasion that me needed transportation the staff was very helpful in navigating the subways. John (think he's the manager) was also a wealth of information on the sites of New York.; where to grab a beer, get a morning coffee & bagel, galleries to visit, stores to drool in (ABC Carpet). Not only will we stay there again (love to take my husband now), but I have referred the hotel to many friends

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: jsgram
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a "Superior" room. It included a queen bed and private bath. The room was very clean and smelled fresh. We were pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was great for the price. We were about 10 blocks from Times Square and two blocks from Penn Station. We found it very easy to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive for a small room”
Reviews.Author: Deana73
Reviews.Content: this should be called a hostel and not hotel.then it should be fine for me. keep on reminding myself that it look very hostel. stayed in a quad room for 2 nights and moved to the dorm for 2 nights. most time spent outside so didn't really stayed very long.location is good. staffs need to be more friendly or find work somewhere else. lady staff- met only one is very unfriendly and racist. spoke very nice to a couple for at least 15 mins telling them all places to go, without bothering that i am waiting in line, then when it was my turn, doesn't even look at my eyes( i look chinese btw). the 2 men are okay although i can't even see any smile from them. working in a hotel you will need all the smiles guys...

Reviews.Title: “Hostel pretending to be a hotel and not even a good one!!!”
Reviews.Author: chrisandsusanne
Reviews.Content: Firstly this is not a hotel but a hostel and not a very good one either. Having travelled around Australia and the US for 6 months, mainly staying in hostels I can honestly say that this does not even come close to their standards. We even paid a lot less at the Luxor in Vegas and that was a decent hotel. Well our room, number 110 was so tiny we could barely fit our luggage in it - it reminded me of a prison cell only it was painted bright pink. I was really impressed by their website and how cool the themed rooms looked but it just shows what some good photography can do. The paintwork was shody and unenviting. The bed squeaked loudly and slanted as u moved, it was stuffy and the noise from the road was unbearable. The windows are not double galzed and there are gaps where the airconditioning unit is fitted so it sounds as if the window is open all the time. Also there is just one restroom with toilet and shower combined for around 10 rooms on our floor. On my first visit they were not clean either with hair everywhere on the floor and in the shower. Now we are not usually people to complain and are generally easily pleased. We are used to basic accomodation , and don't tend to expect too much, seeing places often as a place to get a good night sleep. However this place was just unacceptable, especially for what we paid. It cost us $140 a night - our most expensive accomodation yet in 6 months and most certainly the worst. I know NY is expensive but they should not advertise as a hotel and the website is misleading, conjuering up an image of a cute themed hotel. Unless you see are room and hear the noise u just would not beleive it. I was so dissapointed as we were in NY for 4 nights and wanted to enjoy it. I had no sleep and felt really ripped off. I will definately not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: Melbournechick
Reviews.Content: I agree with all of the recent comments, I was a bit unsure about staying here but who can argue with the price. The location was great and it has recently had some renovations done. We were pleasantly surprised by the helpful staff and the cleanliness of everything. Upon arrival we heard a couple complaining about the size of the room but we already knew it was going to be tiny, you can tell by the photos on the website! The staff member apologised that she was not able to upgrade us for the first night but that we would be for the second night and our bags moved for us whilst we were out. The room really was all we needed, a bed! and the bathroom just down the hall. We were never there so we felt we got more than our money's worth in New York. The upgrade was nice especially with our own bathroom, the noise can be difficult but we were sightseeing during the day and out at shows at night so we did not suffer too much. I would stay again and have recommended to plenty of friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: DebFromMN
Reviews.Content: Great place. Clean rooms and great service! We had a superior room #403 with its own bathroom. I was pleasantly surprised by how clean it was. The room is small, not much bigger than the queen size bed, 2 night stands, and small desk/dresser. There is a small closet rod to hang some clothing. The television reception was not very good, but who watches tv when you visit New York? The windows were a little hard to open, they stuck a little & had to push pretty hard. The room faced the street and was a little noisy. But it was not enough to keep me awake, I slept just fine. The bathroom was clean and we were given fresh towels daily. The shower lacks water pressure. The entrance was a little hard to figure out since you have to press a button near the door to be buzzed in. It felt like we were using the back door entrance, but it is the only entrance. The lobby is up one flight of stairs from the entrance. Then our room was up 2 more flights. No elevator, so you get a workout. Nice little courtyard. There is internet access in the main hall area, I think you have to pay for it. I was able to access wireless internet in my room on my laptop for free. Good location. 2 blocks from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. Great little pub, the Molly Wee, across the street. Plenty of delis and restaurants nearby. We were given a couple of maps when we checked in and they came in handy. Overall, it was the perfect place to stay and I would stay again when I return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MoGreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chelsea Star Hotel for 6 nights for a shopping/sightseeing holiday. As New York is a pretty pricey place to stay, I did loads of research and came across this hotel because of its competitive rates and good location. I would certainly recommend it - its located in the heart of the city. The room was made daily, with a small kitchenette (microwave/fridge/coffee machine) and fresh sheets and towels provided. After reading some reviews on this website I asked for a room facing away from the road - we were put up in room 4R (3 queen sized beds on the 4th floor facing the courtyard). My only reservations would be that it was a bit of a hike up to the 4th floor (especially after a hard days shopping!!) and the nearest subway station is about 2 blocks away. otherwise no complaints - would definitely consider returning on my next trip to the Big Apple...

Reviews.Title: “good place for the price”
Reviews.Author: pigeonman
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the chelsea star hotel last week, the weather was horrible in nyc, rain and more rain, but it was nice to have a clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff and the hotels location (close to most of the sights, subways ...) to make the few days i stayed in nyc enjoyable. i slept in the cool coney island room, new comfortable bed, wood floor and good design. my next trip i will stay at the chelsea star again, hoping that i will have nice weather to walk around the city

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: pneuma
Reviews.Content: We (2 people) stayed in a superior room, and are left wondering why they would lie about such a petty things as tv. We were told we would get basic cable and flatscreen tv; none of which were present in the room. We got a regular TV set + network channels, but what the hell! The room was perfect! Nice aircon, bathtub, hot water, new towels every day.... the location is perfect, VERY close to Madison Sq Garden and A, C, E-subway trains from both 34th and 23rd St stations. As far as I can see, this hotel has it all, so why lie about such a petty thing as television? Cheap internet is available, free coffee in the mornings... i'm a happy camper, no matter what channels are available on the screen. I'm definately coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hostel”
Reviews.Author: Bundini77
Reviews.Content: This review is for a 10 bedded dorm room at Chelsea Star. Although my review is for the hostel room I am sure there are some issues that will apply to the hotel as well. This was my second stay in a hostel. I decided to try Chelsea Star because of the location and price. The price was cheaper than some of the hostels in upper Manhattan (103rd Street) and it has a great location. I flew into Newark and I took a bus to Port Authority at 42nd and 8th. From Port Authority I took the A or C subway train to 34th and 8th. From there I walked to 30th and 8th. The hostel is centrally located and it is only a couple of blocks from Madison Square Gardens. Upon check-in I found the front desk clerks to be very indifferent to the customers. They were very nonchalant and they did not seem friendly at all. The lobby was very nice and the terrace was very well lit and inviting at night. The room was pretty nice as well. I was surprised to have a bathroom in the room and it was very nice and clean as well. The only problem I found with the bathroom was the privacy factor. If you eat gassy food like chili you may be a little embarrassed because the bathroom is right there amongst strangers. Also, if you needed to use the facilities you had to wait for the person ahead of you to finish their duties before you could enter. There was a very simple solution to these bathroom issues though. There are communal bathrooms in the hallway and you can use the restroom there as well as take a shower. Very convenient. Issues with this location: The hallways are very narrow and the floor is metal (see my photos). Although they have a red carpet over the floor you could hear each and every person that walked down the hallway. My bed was close to the door and the floor would shake every time someone walked by. Also, you could clearly hear every conversation that went on in the hallways. The hall is narrow so people did not tend to linger. The other issue was the noise from outside. The hostel is located on 30th Street and 8th Avenue. 8th Avenue is very busy and noisy all day. I could hear horns blowing, sirens blasting, trash trucks beeping, people laughing and talking on the sidewalk, and believe it or not I could hear the subway. I kept hearing a noise every so often and I could not see where it was coming from. The noise comes from the sidewalk vents (do not know the proper term) and you could hear the subway trains each time they passed by. This was a huge issue when I first arrived. After awhile I was able to get used to the noise and move on. I am sure this is an issue at some of the finer hotels in NYC as well. Cabs blowing horns and sirens are a big part of NYC and this cannot be avoided in central locations of NYC. If you have trouble sleeping or if you are sensitive to noise you should request a room that is not facing 8th Avenue. Since this hostel is in the middle of a lot of attractions you must be prepared for noise or bring ear plugs. Otherwise, you may want to book something in upper Manhattan that has less traffic and action. Overall this was a very pleasant experience. I did not like the fact that they did not have lockers in the dorm rooms but I felt safe leaving my things in the room. The roommates were all friendly and everyone spoke and smiled at each other. One thing to remember is that this is a cheaper, lower scale hotel/hostel. You get what you pay for. You can't expect to pay a lower rate and have the accommodations of a five star hotel. Although this is a lower scale facility they have a very nice establishment and it is very worth the price. I definitely plan to stay here again and I give Chelsea Star two thumbs up. The place is very clean and has a clean feel to it. I am not sure how the hotel rooms are so I cannot comment about those. The property exceeded my expectations and I consider this one of the top hostels to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for a hostel, but wake-up call service is not reliable.”
Reviews.Author: fe79
Reviews.Content: I was staying in an 8-bed mix dorm. The room was okay, bathroom was cleaned everyday. Nearby Penn Station, great location. Not bad for a hostel. But the wake-up call service was not reliable, I almost missed my flight because the night shift did not wake me up...it is better to bring your own alarm if you need a wake-up call service.

Reviews.Title: “for the price.... not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: travel_girlie77
Reviews.Content: Booked this budget property with a friend for a shopping weekend in New York. Knew we wouldn't spend much time in the room so weren't that concerned about getting something fancy. Booked a deluxe room on the website for a 3-nights-for-the-price-of-2 special. Ended up paying $300 for 3 nights. Much of what people comment on is true.... loud 8th avenue all night, lack of visible cleaning, lockouts at the front door..... but, for reasonable price this hotel is in a great location; close to Penn station, subways and Macy's. If you are going to stay here book a deluxe with bathroom room, saw the others and understand why people weren't happy!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seems”
Reviews.Author: skybluestratocaster
Reviews.Content: When i booked this hotel ,it looked fine on the web site.On arrival it turned out to be a grubby little affair.As we walked up the steps to the reception we knew we were in a dump.I dont think the steps had been mopped that week.We booked a double room but on arrival he stuck us in a ran down apartment(he said we were upgraded)out on the street fcing 8th ave even though on booking i requested a room facing away from 8th ave because of the noise.He said it would not be a problem.The window kept on opening in on us.There was a 2 inch gap underneath the window letting in cold air.it felt as though it was not safe being on the groung floor.The blinds were useless as they are all bent so if you want to change or do anything of a sexual nature the people from the street get a free show.There was no toilet roll holder.The wardrobe door was badly damaged.The place badly needed a lick of paint and tidying up.when we got our room in the main building it was tiny.Very very very cramped.The room was just the width of the bed.The room badly needed refurbishment.The bare dirty floorboards were exposed along the skirting and heating pipes ran along the side of the wall.Im sure they were once covered but i think the repair man waldo must be too busy carrying suitcases to fix it up.The bed was use less.Myself and my wife kept falling into the centre of the mattress as it sunk down when you lay on it.You have to share a bathroom.NOT GOOD.I did not like the manager of the hotel.,you could tell he was not having a good day.He just wanted to be somewhere else..Maybe he could try smiling sometime.. Damien.Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Cold and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Little_Miss_Holly
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Chelsea Star very nearly ruined my first time in NY. The room we were allocated was beyond small. We had to rearrange the room in order to get 2 people and 2 cases in. Apart from the size of the room, it was incredibly cold. When we complained, after one of us became ill, we were issued with a radiator and another blanket. Fine, though not really good enough when the window still let in so much cold air we were reduced to wearing hats in bed. As for the noise, well it forced us to buy earplugs! The staff were unfriendly to boot. Reasons to stay at the Star - the location is pretty good. Apart from that, give it a miss!

Reviews.Title: “Would'nt return”
Reviews.Author: pumperley
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 consecutive nights and 1 return night as we spent some time away from NYC. I booked based on the generally good feedback I found on nthe net and the relative cheapness. Our first room was on the top floor and right on the corner. there is a traffic lighted crossroads outside which was, as you would expect, very noisy. The room was extremely hot which meant we had to have the window open leading to mad levels of noise during the night. I spoke with the impersonal female receptionist (I'm not sure she's suited to this kind of work) who was more concerned about making excuses than trying to help. After approaching her for a 2nd time we were moved to a 1st level room that was bigger, cooler and less noisy. Unfortunately it was after staying here that I found what I think are bed bug bites on my arm, although as I was not sure I did'nt alert them to it. For our, final, return night we were fortunate to get an upgrade although this was clearly done as a convenience to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lose the female receptionist!!”
Reviews.Author: kiwishoeshine
Reviews.Content: We are five girls from Ireland who thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Chelsea Star Hotel. Great location, great price, large clean rooms. In general ,we found our stay here a positive experience expcept for the creaky beds and the unhelpful female receptionist who appeared disinterested and was rude at times. We understand the hotel is busy and her job at times may be hectic, however a little courtesy goes a long way and is much appreciated. We hope that if she ever had the chance to visit Ireland that she would not experience the attitude she displays and would appreciate the great Irish hospitality which would be provided. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ajv
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location. I stayed in a single and it was tiny, but other than that it exceeded my expectations. Bathrooms were usually clean and dry. Very friendly staff. No bugs, no dust, and air conditioning worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, small”
Reviews.Author: Killio
Reviews.Content: I went here for 5 days with my girlfriend, it was horrable. The room was not clean (even the bed was not clean and beneeth the bed... don't look!), it just fits one queen bed, and the room was full. we could not place our suitecases in the room so small. Location was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: angelicface11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a budget hotel but that's OK. All the rooms have a theme and although not en-suite, we were just opposite the bathroom which was always spotless and we never had to queue to use it. The rooms were also clean although the bed was a little lop-sided! Location-wise, this was great. It was just a few blocks from the Empire State Building and Macys (a bit longer to Times Square but not much) and we could see Madison Square Gardens from our window. The area felt safe, even at night. I would definitely recommend this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Minimal frills in a great location”
Reviews.Author: deeforce
Reviews.Content: After being booted from a standby flight and being stranded in NYC one more night, the kids at the Chelsea Star saved me with an available room and a good price (I got a pvt bathroom at the shared bathroom rate because the a/c wasn't working, but there was a big honkin' fan, so I got over it). Friendly front desk kid and cute overall design. AND I walked in off the street at 10pm and yet they still managed to help me out. Right on.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Sophie
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Star Hotel is located in the heart of Manhattan. Only five minutes from The Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Fifth Avenue, Broadway. Ten minutes to Times Square and 42nd Street. The Location is unique and perfect! The hotel is rather small, the staff is friendly. When we arrived, the recepionist told us that we will have a superior room on the second floor. He helped us with the luggage and was very friendly. When we entered the room, we were a bit disappointed, because it was really small and we could hear our neighbours as if they were right with us in our room... The bathroom was very new and clean, but we asked for antother one because of the noise from next door! We were upgraded to a deluxe room without any problems. Room "1N" was in the building next door. The appartment is on the first floor, has noble parquet and two double beds. There is also a kitchen where you could prepare your meals yourself, a fridge and so on. But as there are so many nice places to go and eat in the neighborhood, we didn't use it! The bathroom is small but clean and nice. The rooms were cleaned every day. We felt like Carrie in Sex and the City as the appartment was really a "New Yorker Appartment", not a hotel! The only problem we had was the heating! As the room is situated on the first floor and the heating is right next to the beds and it couldn't be controlled by ourselves but only by the receptionist, we had tropical temperatures although it was winter and really cold outside! We only needed the thin sheet as a blanket and couldn't open the window the whole night because of the noise from the street whicht is a bit annoying but normal for NYC and after a few hours, you will be able to ignore it. The location will make up for the noise! We were upgraded to a deluxe room without having to pay more and they let us stay in the nice appartment "1N" for all of our nine nights! We also felt save and comfortable in the Chelsea Star Hotel! It is comparable to a German standard of three stars I guess. Enjoy NY and your stay at The Chelsea Star Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you need more room”
Reviews.Author: HMCPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at 3 star hotels, so I was a bit wary about the Chelsea Star. With my Father visiting from abroad, I needed room for 3 adults and 2 kids. Given the exorbitant rates in the Manhattan area, I booked the 2 room deluxe suite at the Chelsea Star. We requested a room facing the back (based on previous reviews on your site). Once inside, I really couldn't complain, there were 2 rooms, with three double beds, and a kitchenette. All the rooms were very clean, and the bathroom was a good size. The floor was laminate, and the paintwork fresh. The microwave and fridge really came in handy. I should say the furniture was very basic, and no frills in terms of desks etc., but the air conditioning was quiet and worked well. Also there was no street noise, and we all slept well. You are given keys to your apartment and the entrance to the buliding, and I did not have any concerns about our safety. In fact my son said that New York was more pleasant than he expected! The area is very convenient, clearly not upscale, but it's New York, and that comes with the territory. There are several reasonably priced restaurants nearby, so it is easy to pick up coffee, take-out etc. So unless you are extremely fussy about fancy drapes and toiletries, and want to spend 100's more, for a smaller room but with a fancy lobby, give the Chelsea Star a try.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a native New Yorker”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little weary about staying at the Chelsea Star after reading some of the reviews, but it was very affordable and I decided to take a chance and go for it. Me and 4 friends rented the apartment suite, and WE LOVED IT. PROS: The room was a lot bigger than we all expected, especially my sister, who has stayed in hotels that were 3 times the price and less than half the size. The location is great...close enough to Times Square but far enough that I actually felt like a native New Yorker when we went "home" for the night. We bought groceries and pastries at the deli and bakery across the street (the coffee at the deli tastes better!!) and Subway is right next door...so you don't have to go far to get a late night snack. Our apartment suite was next door to the main building in what appeared to be an old apartment building. We had room 1R, which has a back door that goes out to a private rock garden area (just past the trash cans : ( ), and stairs up to the balcony area. It was only a few blocks from Penn Station, very convenient for us since we took the train from New Jersey. The beds were super comfortable, and the air condition was working very well (important for when you are visiting in the summer!) The sheets were clean and there were plenty of towels to go around. CONS: So it was bigger than expected, but the 3 beds I was promised actually turned out to be 2 beds and a pull out couch. The pull out couch was so uncomfortable for my sister that she had to sleep with my girl friend and I. Late night walks from site-seeing might be a little scary for a single woman traveling alone. Best to go in groups. OVERALL: I would definatley stay there again. Like I said, I felt like a native New Yorker with my very own apartment. : ) Definatley NOT the Marriott, but way better than a Motel 6. Would recommend if you REALLY want to experience New York as a native, not a visitor

Reviews.Title: “Be cafeful if traveling alone”
Reviews.Author: wonkybusker
Reviews.Content: I have never turned down a hotel or hostel anywhere in the world, but after one night at this place, I checked out early. When I confirmed to the person at the front desk that there would only be one person in the room, me, I was informed that I was upgraded to a suite. This was weird, but maybe a coincidence. The suite was in an apartment building next door, which the hotel also owns and had a broken gate lock and a broken front door lock. It seemed very clean, although one of the pillows smelled awful. I was woken up sometime after midnight to someone buzzing on the doorbell. I don't scare easily, but this whole experience was very sketchy and I didn't feel safe staying there a second night.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Swirly Carpets!”
Reviews.Author: ATraveller_7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night stay at the Chelsea Star. Yes on the plus side the hotel does have a good location (approximately 10 blocks from Time Square) however we did not enjoy our stay here. The decor of our superior room was definately for those who love swirly multi-coloured carpets and bright yellow walls. There seemed to be a very distinctive smell throughout our stay, which appeared to be a mix of strong airfreshener and the smell of the sandwich shop a few doors down. This became increasingly nauseating as our trip went on. The reception staff blew hot and cold like the weather in the attitude towards us which is the last thing you need when on holiday. The most irritating aspect of our room was the adjoining door between us and next door. I suspect the door was made out of tissue paper, because we could hear every word our next door neighbours were saying!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Price, 5 Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night shopping trip in New York and stayed in the Chelsea Star Hotel. Do not be put off by the entrance of the hotel, it is just one block away from Madison Square Gardens. Inside, it is colourful and friendly and extremely clean. Myself and my friend stayed in a Deluxe room with a very roomy King Size bed with an ensuite bathroom. Room was cleaned on a daily basis with fresh towels and we also got fresh flowers in our room. So central for everything in New York and the staff are extremely helpful with maps, tour operators etc....Also, have a man who will carry down luggage etc....All the major sites are within walking distance from the hotel e.g. Macys, Empire State building. Would definitely recommend this to anybody visiting New York, wanting to spend their money on anything else other than accomodation! Cheap but extremely cheerful! Looking forward to my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad ... you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Melbournebelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chelsea Star Hostel/Hotel in NYC in December 2005. We chose this hotel simply because it was affordable(hotels in NYC are extortionately expensive) and in a good location. We had a room with our own private bathroom, which was nice. Negatives ..... Room was tiny in size, but did the job for the four days we were there. Walls are paper thin - we could hear others snoring and people clomping down the hallway and having conversations in the middle of the night. Hotel security pass didn't work at times, and when we reported it we were told that as long as it worked in the room then it didn't matter if it didn't work to get into the hotel! Our opinion was that if it was the middle of the night and I (a female) was stranded out there in the snow on my own trying to get inside it wouldn't be the safest arrangement. It's fine if the receptionist is at the desk, but not soo good when you are pushing the intercom button a million times and not getting any response (it was just lucky when this happened that others were leaving the hotel and let us in). Also, we booked a room with a queen sized bed and upon checking in we discovered it was actually two single beds pushed together with a plank of wood joining the two beds. When my husband and I laid on it, the whole thing collapsed. Positives ... All in all though, it wasn't a bad hotel, it was in an excellent location, it was clean and it was inexpensive and provided us with a place to sleep and shower whilst staying in New York, which was all we really needed.

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea Star Hotel....True Star of New York”
Reviews.Author: MissyUK
Reviews.Content: This review is a long time coming, but anyway, here goes... We spent a week at the Chelsea Star Hotel and cannot praise it highly enough. Our room had clean sheets and towels daily, we had a shared bathroom, but don't let that put you off, there are more bathrooms available on the other floors, so take your pick. I stayed there with my 2 teenagers and they loved it, for the location and the friendly and helpful staff. The receptionist could not have been more helpful if he tried. If you're on a budget give it a go, it doesn't have all the frills that an upmarket hotel would offer, but i would rather spend my money on eating/drinking out and having fun than on a hotel room! We will definately return, trye value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Definite Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Chelsea Star Hotel for Thanksgiving this year. It was perfect! I had booked a double room with shared bathroom but when we got there they had upgraded us to an ensuite bedroom...never gave a reason why so we didn't ask!:) It was really good value for money and in a perfect location. I would really recommend this hotel for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Star is in a great location, accessible to all the main sites and is literally across the road from Penn station and Madison Square Garden. True, the rooms are small, but if you're going to New York City, chance are you won't be spending much time there anyway!! There's a subway station two minutes away which will connect you to anywhere in the city, the staff were very helpful, the rooms were cleaned and bed linen changed every other day. We couldn't believe that we could get this standard for this price. Highly recommended if you're on a budget or you've got better things to spend your money on - and in this city there is definitely lots to be buying, those shops are toooooo goooood!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good experience in this tiny hotel with a lot of charm. Room very clean and a lot of space. Amazing bathroon for NY. Location is not great and people don't smile easily but We definitively recommand you this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT time!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No, the Chelsea Star is not fancy, but it is clean and affordable. I booked a double room with a shared bath and was upgraded to a superior room because it was my birthday. The room was clean, the batroom clean, and my room was serviced the next day while I was out. Ok, so the tv was a little fuzzy on some channels, but so what! I wasn't in New York to watch tv. The hotel has a great location; I walked to most of my destinations. The service was very friendly and helpful. The ac was very, very cold. The water pressure was not too great, but the the water stayed hot the entire time I was in the shower. I really enjoyed my stay at the Chelsea Star and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, funky, dive!”
Reviews.Author: Doxiegal
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and I just got back from our big trip to New York where we chose to stay in three different hotels to enhance our experience. My daughter picked the Chelase Star as it sound "cool", I agree'd because of price and I was mixed up with the classic Chelsea Hotel. We arrived by cab in front of a Subway restaurant and flower shop, we looked at the cab driver like he had 3 heads as he pointed to the sign reading the name Chelsea Star. I instantly felt sick, once we got inside my spirits picked up a bit as it was really decorated cute with bright yellow halls, metal doors and stars stenciled through out. We first had the "King and I " room and again my heart sank, very, very small, and dark and dingy looking. I went to the front desk to see how muchi t would cost me to get a two bed room and he advised me that really they were intended for 4 people but asked if we would like to see the "Coney Island" room. This room was indeed bigger and much brighter so we stayed. I disagree with some of the reviews on the cleanliness as I felt our room was very clean and the bedding was very white and no smell at all to the blankets. The noise was almost unbearable, not from other rooms but from 8th street. I really knew I was in NY City as I listened to horns honking, a fight from the little bar down the street and some loud mouth yelling at his friends all night. I must say that it was quieter from 1-6am. The bathrooms were not spotless and there was no shelving or hooks to put your clothes or towels on while showering and I really did not want to sit them on the toilet. The shower stalls and bathroom were dark stone and gave it a dingy feel, my daughter disagrees she loved the look of the bathroom. The bathrooms were busier than the other hotel we had stayed at and you knew when someone had showered and the garbages were not emptied constantly as the other place we stayed. The location is very handy, with subway 4 blocks down and airport shuttle to Newark as well, only 13.00 a huge savings over a cab! It is a grubbier area so walking late at night kept me on my toes. All in all, this place was an old dive of a hotel fixed up to the best of anyones ability, they kept it relatively clean and the staff were pleasant and helpful. Great for the young perhaps but even my daughter is not sure she will return and it was not cheap for what you got. Don't get caught up in the cute theme room concept, for the same price you could stay at Hotel 17...read that review!

Reviews.Title: “Surviving The Chelsea Star”
Reviews.Author: Milnoc
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Star is a tourist class hotel located in a yellow building on the southwest corner of West 30 Street and 8th Avenue, a stone’s throw away from Penn Station and the 34 Street subway stations, with the hotel’s only entrance located on West 30 Street. Look for the stars imprinted in the sidewalk cement. The hotel itself is actually located on the second floor of the building, occupying three full floors, and has no elevator. So people with heavy luggage may want to avoid this hotel unless you don’t mind the workout. All the private rooms with shared baths are painted and decorated in different themes such as the Rudolph Valentino room, the New York Nights room, and the Madonna. The private rooms with private baths have upgraded accommodations for those wanting more privacy. The hotel also includes dormitory rooms that can be reserved for a maximum of two weeks and can’t be reserved again by the same people for six months afterwards, preventing vagrants from taking up “permanent residence” at the hotel. Check-in went reasonably well. Not only did the hotel have my reservation, they were also able to assign me the room that I’ve requested, the “Madame Butterfly” room, located on the fourth floor and decorated with Asian elements. As you can see from the pictures, the room is very small, but that in itself wasn’t much of a deterrent since it was just enough space for my needs, it was cheap, and most importantly the air conditioner worked properly. Noise was a problem with the room, but not necessarily from the adjoining rooms (I lucked out on thick walls). Much of the noise came from 8th avenue itself, consisting mostly of taxis honking their horns whenever someone got in their way. One way to cut down on the noise is to sleep with your head close to the door instead of the window. The room also had a few other irritants. First, I saw the resident mouse try to escape from my room, making me wonder if it was something about me personally that the mouse didn’t like. Second, along with the dirty carpet as seen in the images, many parts of the room were not properly cleaned such as the phone and the space under the Buddha statuette. Third, the electrical extensions powering the TV were originally stapled to the wall, but eventually came loose over time. Unfortunately, the staples were shot right through the electrical conductors, creating a potentially fatal shock hazard. I showed the wiring to the resident handyman and he replaced it right away. The shared washroom was probably as clean as it could ever be considering it’s the middle of summer, it’s hot and humid, and just about everyone needed to take at least two showers per day just to feel slightly clean. The sink and toilet were fine for their respective duties, but the shower faucets were a bit of a challenge. Turn the hot water faucet, wait for hot water to eventually come out from the showerhead, and then turn the cold water faucet to prevent scalding. In this hotel, water pressure and faucet control are the main plumbing problems. I had to use the third floor washroom one morning because the fourth floor washroom was occupied for a long time (the only time this happened). I discovered that the tap water tasted a bit different depending on which floor you resided. While the fourth floor’s water tasted reasonably neutral for a big city water supply, the third floor’s water had the distinct after-taste of a men’s public washroom. After brushing my teeth, all the toothpaste did was add a mint-flavoured coating to the toilet after-taste, similar to what you would probably experience if you tried eating urinal cakes. The terrace was a decent oasis from the outside world as long as you didn’t mind the rumbling of half a dozen air conditioning units and the site of a few plastic garbage cans at one end which are conveniently hidden from the hotel’s official photos. The patio furniture however was of reasonable quality, and the garbage cans emanated no objectionable smells considering the hotel doesn’t distribute or even allow food in the rooms. The guests themselves were reasonably well behaved and for the most part tried to keep the noise level down to a minimum which isn’t easy considering that despite the metal covering on the room doors, noise would easily pass through them as if they were made of paper. Final tidbits: staff members for the most part were reasonably helpful, and the room key never worked on the hotel’s outdoor card reader. All in all, my stay at The Chelsea Star was a New York Experience in itself, and not necessarily an objectionable one. But would I want to go through the same experience twice? Probably not. This doesn’t necessarily mean I would prefer to stay in a more expensive hotel the next time I’m in the city, but it does mean I’ll want to try out a different tourist class hotel in another part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, convenient and great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on trip advisor before going but after booking so perhaps was expecting the worst of this hotel. I was very surprised and have to disagree with many of the more negative reviews. The Chelsea Star is not hard to find, it is on the corner by the flower stand and whilst it does not have the grand entrance of the Plaza it is well sign posted. The reception was very friendly and they did have our booking but were (not surprisingly for the May Day Holiday) overbooked so asked if we would move from the Superior to the Deluxe room. Initially we said no and they upheld the original reservation, but having seen both rooms we decided to move taking advantage of the discount they offered for our inconvenience. Both rooms we stayed in were clean, sufficiently big for a hotel room in New York which was used essentially for sleeping and showering. The beds were very large and comfortable although I would not recommend the sofa bed in the superior room. The service was at all times very friendly and efficient and what better location could you ask for. I agree it is not a 5 star hotel, but for the money and the sheer convenience of location I thought it was excellent. I will definitely go back especially now that the Plaza has closed! I can also recommend the Cheyenne Diner (featured on the Tropicana advert currently)and the Stage Door both close by for great brunch and the Chelsea Bar and Brasserie for delicious French food with US style service!

Reviews.Title: “Dorm beds are worth the price $35”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with another female traveller in september for the last three nights of my trip. We booked the dorm beds as we were definately on a budget! At $35 they are the average price for New York in Sept. I rang from Philadelphia to confirm my booking two days before and when we arrived everything was ready for us.
