Its true that to get in you have to ring the bell and hope someone on reception answers, but i guess we were lucky as they did straight away. We ended up in a two bunk room sharing with two german boys... This was perfect as there was enough space for all our things without us having to get to know each other too intimately!! There was a TV which did have bad reception, but as has been mentioned before...You're in NYC!!! Go out! The locations great....so close to Penn station and the airport bus stop to Newark and JFK. You can walk all the way down town to the Statten Island Ferry very quickly and if you walk a little way down eigth avenue you'll find a loverly Bagel shop on the left hand side ($1 brekkie). There is a subway sandwich below but i deffs couldnt smell them! Plus there $1.99 specials each day make life cheap if u are poor like me! You can hear the traffic in the room but deffs get used to it. The common area to sit outside is ok just to chill between exploring. The Bathrooms. Right. Well, I had no problems with them having stayed in places where they have been twenty times worse! But they arnt the cleanest things you'll ever use. However if you simply take your own soap, and try and guarantee you have some flip flops with you and your own towel you should do just fine! They were cleaned when i was there, dunno bout now! People on reception were really nice! I think i might have met the girl that everyone has been going on about as being horrid, but i guarantee if you go talk to her and make her talk to you by asking for help with directions etc she can be way helpful! Having stayed previously at the Milford Plaza near to Broadway for $135 a night (a loverly hotel and very nice peeps etc, but too expensive for my budget), and Jazz on the town (the most hideous place ever ever) which was about $30, I can certainly suggest this place for people who are travellers and have therefore always seen something worst than the place they are! I suggest spending a night at jazz on the town before transfering here if you don't think you have! I expect i will return here next summer or try out sugar hill in harlem if not....

Reviews.Title: “great value.. great locatoin”
Reviews.Author: janeybanjo
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in many hotels in nyc, this one is no better or worse than more expensive hotels we have stayed in ..in fact we booked in for an extra night , it is in an excellent location.. was a little noisy ,but for gods sake you are in a big city! and it was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “You better Re Confirm...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room only to show up and be told that it had been given away. At this place, check in time means check in or lose your room time. It should really be called a check in deadline to be more accurate. The guy at the desk was nice, but what kind of ---- is this for a weary traveller to deal with. "Sorry, but find another hotel in New York at a moment's notice. Thanks for NOTHING!

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect a room if you reserve one”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at the Chelsea Star hotel for 12/13/04, using the hotel's website and my valid credit card. I provided all the information that was required. We chose this location for price, it looked interesting and because it was within close walking distance of a venue we were attending during our one day trip. I recieved a confirmation email from them that my credit card had been processed and another one stating: "Thank you for choosing the Chelsea Star Hotel for your New York City lodging needs. We look forward to your arrival and plan to make your New York experience a very special one!" My reservation was for a deluxe room and my confirmation number was: 821769 It clearly states on the Chelsea Star website that this confirmation is a GUARANTEE that the room will be available when they say it is. Don't get your hopes up. There is a prompt on the reservation form that asks what time you will be checking in. Make sure you arrive prior to that time and wait for your room, because if you are late, they will release the room. Of course there is no indication that they are going to do this, as it seems like they just ask that question to make sure that the room is ready for you when you arrive. My travel partner chose 3pm, and we arrived at 3:45. Upon our arrival I was notified by the friendly but less than helpful desk clerk that my "deluxe" room had been given away and I would be staying in a "superior" room. Unfortunately this was the room that my travel partners, who were standing next to me at the time had reserved. The clerk fed us a line about how my friend needed to "reconfirm because you're late (45 minutes late on a room confirmed with a valid credit card) and we gave the room away" and that there were no other rooms available to accomodate them. The icing on the cake was that they bumped me down a notch into their room just becasue I registered first. The clerk referred us to another hotel, and since we only had an hour to check in and get ready for the event we were attending, we had no choice but to quickly drive across town to the other hotel, (see the review of that disaster elsewhere). He also said he would call and reserve a room for us there, but we watched as he called their so called "partner hotel" and simply asked if there were rooms available. No pricing info, no alternates, nothing. Basically, he offered us directions and gave us a map and said "you are here, the hotel is over here". Not very helpful. The new hotel was about thirty blocks away from our desired location, which was within walking distance of the Chelsea Star. The prior arrangements we made to park our car in Chelsea were useless, so we had to pay an arm and a leg for parking. All told, between the cost of cab rides, parking and the new hotel, we lost out on any money we would have saved by staying at the Chelsea Star. I won't even mention the time that we wasted dealing with this fiasco. It seems from other reviews that this is the M.O. for this hotel. I would not recommend this non-experience to anyone looking to drop their bags and relax in the great city of New York. I travel frequently and enjoy staying at out of the way places that may not offer the same homogenized experience as a regular run of the mill hotel. It would have been nice to have a positive experience at this hotel as I have had at many others like it. Unfortunately "Funky" not only refers to the decor, but also to the way they run the business. If you still choose to brave these odd reservation policies, I would suggest calling the desk every five minutes until you arrive to make sure your "reservation" still exists. Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “Star shines bright.”
Reviews.Author: NikEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This "Star" shines bright in the heart of NYC. Our party of 5 took 3 rooms for 5 nights in November 2004 and found the Chelsea Star a haven among the craziness of New York. Bear in mind this is a budget hotel, if you expect Plaza style service, go pay Plaza prices. We occupied a Superior double, a double and a single. The Superior was magnificent (considering the price) with a four poster bed that would sleep 5, very spacious, clean tidy and warm. With windows onto to the street it is a bit noisy, but hey it's New York City outside. The double was the Madonna Room, which is the very room Madonna stayed in when she moved to the city. It was covered in photo's, records etc. The single room does what it says on the tin, a small room with a single bed and a T.V. The double and the single have shared shower facilities which aren't a problem as the shower is next to the room and were very clean and tidy. The big plus for this hotel is the location. On the fringe of Chelsea it's located in a vibrant neighbourhood, all your needs are on your doorstep. Go for breakfast in the Tick Tock Diner (200m up 8th Ave), grab a sub from the Gardenia Deli across the street along with an excellent range of brewski's. Don't miss out on a visit to D'Autio's for a slice of the Worlds best cheese cake and a cup of the excellent 75c coffee, it's just around the corner. The patio area of the hotel is tremendous to sit and eat lunch with a lovely afternoon beer, it also gives you the chance to chat to other guests and swap stories and tips. With most attractions in walking distance but with a feeling of being a world away from the Times Square madness this hotel is a must for the budget traveller. And hey don't forget to tip the room staff every day, even if it's only a coupla bucks, you think they work here 'cos they're millionaires.

Reviews.Title: “Awful unless you can sleep through anything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Star on the surface is hip and colorful but once you try to bed down for the night you realise that the beauty is only skin deep and the walls are paper thin. During my stay of one night I could hear the man next door snoring, the brits across the hallway talking and watching TV and the guest upstairs walk around and even turn over in bed. We could feel the springs through our mattress and the since we were in the room with a view of the outdoor patio we had a nice floodlamp aimed at our window which was barely blocked out by the venetian blinds. The shower fixture was broken which I managed to fix with a few matchsticks and the water pressure was pitiful. I'm surprised they were even kind enough to endulge us with soap as there certainly weren't any other amenitites you'd expect for the money spent. We checked out the next morning and went to pennsylvania hotel which is nearby and is indeed quiet and comfortable and provided everything you'd expect from a hotel even if is a bit shabby. If you are staying in one of the Chelsea Star's less than $100 rooms with shared bath or bunk beds then you might tolerate all the noise etc for the relative cheapness but for $40 more you can get better service and comfort elsewhere. Otherwise bring an air mattress, a blindfold and earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Lil' Hotel For a Smaller Budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little leery about visiting the hotel after reading some of these reviews. I called a day prior to arriving to verify that my reservation was still valid - and when I showed up the next day, they explained that they had upgraded my room from a theme to "superior" (we had to wait an extra hour and half though) - It has a private bath After we were able to get to the room - I found it to be quite refreshing. It was a tad small - but very clean and well kept. The only major complaints that I had was that the walls were thin (you could definitely hear your neighbor), the TV (which had a DVD player built in) didn't get some channels really well, and the A/C wasn't very good, Lucky for us - we went in November. Since there was no vending machine's or cups for water and such - the Subway Restaurant right below the hotel came in handy On the other hand, the front desk was very helpful - offered us advise on things to do and ways to get around. The location was fantastic - about 2 blocks away from Madison Sq Garden / Penn Station, lots of nifty diner's and food joint's around. There's a quaint little patio for smoking and socializing and there is pay Internet terminal downstairs. I didn't get a chance to see what the Theme rooms looked like - but I did get a chance to see the shared bathroom. On each floor (there are 3) - about 8 rooms share one bathroom (which always looked spotless when I checked). For the price and location, I don't think that this could be beat. And, if you are going to NYC as a tourist, how much time will you spend in the room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “funky and fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, with a funky interior, which surprisingly hides the cheap decor. It is ideally located just around the corner from madison square gardens...so you are almost equal distances from greenwich village and times square. It felt very clean and safe, would recommend it to friends and family. The little courtyard would be great for partying in the summer and there are two irish bars just across the street!! Ideal

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad facilities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Star has only one thing going for it and that is its location. Nothing else. The rooms are tiny, there are virtually no facilities provided, no not even toiletries, and the rooms are horribly done up with some kitschy 'art'. Even the blinds are tattered and there is no space to keep your stuff. The TVs don't work well, forget about the remotes. The place is claustrophobic and uncomfortable.

HotelInfo.Name: Chelsea Star Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 300 W 30th St at 8th Ave, New York City, NY 10001
